description:
First thing first! If you're going to watch a game stop by here first. Best thing I've learned is you can take two drinks from here into the park! The drinks are more than half the price than inside and you can get good beers.  Be sure to tell them to give you it to go otherwise they'll pour it in a glass. Getting into the park from inside is super easy and there's no line. No better way to wait before the game. It gets crowded but it's game day, it's crowded everywhere. 

While waiting we got the nachos. They were good but a little different. Basically comes out as one big nacho. They deep fry tortillas instead of cutting it up. It works out well. You can some soft and some crunchy parts but does get a little messy to share.

Overall great place and great atmosphere before the game!
author: Mark W.

description:
What can I say about the Public House? It's at AT&T Park and has two bars. Every time I go here, it's extremely crowded because it's going to be right before a Giants game. And yes, we went to the Public House and won the game that night, so now I have to go to the Public House and order drinks before every game from now on.

The food here in general is pretty good. It usually takes a while to get because of how busy it is before games. To be honest, I haven't ordered food from here for a long time now because inside the ballpark has some amazing food as well. The bars are a decent size, but it really gets crowded since they're parallel with each other right in front of the entrance way.
author: Willie F.

description:
I came here recently after a giants game after hearing great things and had a great time.

Upon arriving, we were told it was open seating and even though the game had just ended, we had no problem finding a table. Within minutes of sitting down, we were created by our waiter who took our drink orders. It should be noted that this place has an impressive beer list comprised of many locally brewed beers.

After we ordered our drinks we decided to snack on appetizers and ordered the nachos. After ordering, our food arrived in a reasonable amount of time and was well presented. 

The food itself tasted great and the ingredients were of good quality and fresh. We also ordered desert which was just as good.

As far as convenience goes, this place is only convenient if you are attending a giants game or live in the area. There is no parking nearby and traffic in the area is a nightmare. 

The inside of this place is plastered with televisions which would also make it a great place to watch the game if you can't get tickets. Just be warned, prices are a little higher than normal but that is probably due to it being located right outside the ballpark.

Overall, I had a good experience and would come here again in the future.
author: Sean S.

description: It was very crowded when we came in for a drink, but the service was amazing. The bartender helped us right away and the service was excellent.
author: Lydia H.

description:
Everything was 5 stars, Service, food, cleaniness, speed etc but I think it's wayyyyy over priced. Our lunch was over $75! Crazy! Just upgrade from chips to fries will cost like $3 extra smh.

We came just for the impossible burger and it was good but a little dry. I wish I added avcado.
author: Rashni R.

description:
Oh it was fine. The beer was good, it was quiet. Service was nice. The public house burger was on point!! The chips- delicious!!! I'm sure for game day it would be Poppin' 

Nothing that particularly stood out here for me. Overall good
author: Marissa R.

description:
I've never been here for a game but I'm assuming the atmosphere is great, I'll have to check it out. The place is huge, you can even enter the stadium with your tickets at this bar! Although if it's a giveaway day, you won't be receiving your item here. 

This place has a great selection of finger foods for a reasonable price. I don't usually eat corn dogs, but if I ever do, I'm only ever eating them here. They are delicious! I'd never thought I'd find a liking for them again. 

The drink selections are huge. A lot of them I never heard of so I looked them up on my phone. They have two bars, one with just brews and another with liquor and some beers on tap. Seating and standing room is abundant. 

I'll come back soon.
author: Ami S.

description: Enjoyed a good beer and some appetizers before the game. I was pleasantly surprised by the quality of food. It wasn't your standard bar food but they served Niman Ranch meats and Mary's Free Range chicken. Service was attentive and the kitchen speedy.
author: Lori S.

description:
I came here with my team on a weeknight for dinner to try the impossible burger and I must say that I am impressed. If you haven't heard about the impossible burger before, it is basically a burger patty that is plant based and doesn't contain meat - the perfect meal for vegetarians and vegans. I was really surprised by how good the burger was. It was juicy and even pink in the middle like a medium rare burger patty. I would recommend trying this! 

We happened to come on a game day so it was extremely crowded. I dont like that this place is self seating so there are always people standing around aimlessly waiting for a table or eating on counters or empty spaces they could find. It felt very disorganized. I also wasn't really happy with the service. Our server wasn't very friendly and seemed to rush us. I assume non game days are less busy so it may be better to visit on another day if it can be avoided.
author: Claire W.

description:
I came here to try the impossible burger. Walking in, I really like the ambiance of this sports bar. It's located right under at&t park. You can sit wherever you choose: the bar, the high top tables, at normals tables, or outside. There are TVs everywhere, so it's a good spot to watch sports. 

The impossible burger was just okay. Paired with sweet potato fries, it came it to $17 before tax and tip. Kind of steep. The consistency was a little closer to real meat than other veggie burgers I've tried, but the flavor was still off. Glad I tried it once though and at least the fries were yummy! I would come back to this place to watch a game and try some of the other foods they have to offer, but I probably wouldn't order the impossible burger again.
author: Lexi R.

description: Want to eat totally regular quality food for the price of high quality food? This. Is. Your. Spot! Servers are friendly and they serve impossible burgers. Overall good experience
author: David L.

description:
So have you heard about the Impossible Burger? Well, Jamie W. read about it and thought we should try it here since we are on a continual quest to eat healthier. Sure, we've had veggie burgers before, some really good ones like the Black Bean Chipotle Veggie Burger at the Garden Grill up in Guerneville (photo: http://bit.ly/2sn9ifr) and our personal favorite, the Butterbean Burger at the Boiler Room Oyster Bar in Kinston, North Carolina (photo: http://bit.ly/2sAkJAS). So we were intrigued enough by this all-plant variation that we ordered a couple of the $14 ones they served here where our previous dining experiences involved jalapeno poppers, deviled eggs, their regular PH burger, and oh yeah, beer on tap to facilitate the guzzling of such cholesterol-infested grub.

Well, apparently there is no cholesterol in an Impossible Burger nor antibiotics nor meat of any kind. What gives the burger its meaty flavor is heme, which is the non-protein, insoluble, iron protoporphyrin constituent of hemoglobin. Say what? I just copy-pasted that from an online medical dictionary, but that's what makes the patty look, smell, sizzle, bleed, and taste like a regular burger (photo: http://bit.ly/2rgs1pq). And amazingly it did. I was dumbfounded how a vegan burger could taste so carnivorous, but it did even if beef purists likely balk at the notion. It came with provolone melted on top with caramelized onions and a smoke & spice sauce to give it even more of a barbecue flavor (photo: http://bit.ly/2szkciw). Hell, I liked it.

But it's not a perfect substitute since it has five times the sodium and more saturated fats than a regular burger. It's also about the same number of calories in case you are counting, about 220 calories for the patty itself. Give us credit though since we did add the $3 Mixed Greens as a side rather than the fries and ignored the free chips on our plates (photo: http://bit.ly/2rgljQn). We also went with a $6 order of the Crispy Cauliflower with Sweet Pepper Relish, which was a pretty healthy choice for a bar bite (photo: http://bit.ly/2t0UJvO). The vibe was still the same since it first opened, still an extravaganza of flatscreen TVs in a warehouse-size space with a lot of loud youngsters. Regardless, I'd still come back for the Impossible Burger. It was delish...and so good for me?

FOOD - 4 stars...that Impossible Burger seems kinda impossible and a bit overpriced but the meatiness tastes real
AMBIANCE - 2.5 stars...same loud, cavernous bar it's been since it opened 
SERVICE - 3 stars...perhaps tired from his shift, the first server seemed bored with us from the outset but the second was more enthusiastic
TOTAL - 4 stars...definitely will come back for the Impossible Burger
author: Ed U.

description:
We have been back and at the last game decided it was time to update my review. Public House was one of my first reviews here on Yelp........ Ah memories........  

Its still holding onto its solid 4 stars. 

Its still pretty chaotic and they should perhaps explain the process better to people who have never been there. That being said, we did not have to wait long and soon found ourselves a table (carnival seating for those that have never been). Lots of draft beer to chose from and the food was good as always. 

For this meal: 
Truffle Mac and Cheese Fritters: The only letdown. I know better and always order it, but the cheap truffle oil is always a disappointment. The fritters were well fried but the mac and cheese was mostly mac and needed more cheese. It was also a bit bland. We asked for a side of BBQ sauce and that kicked them up. 

Corn: The Elotes was good, but I would prefer it grilled instead of boiled but perhaps that is more of a personal taste thing. 

The PH Burger: with bacon and the works it was really good. Cooked medium rare as requested it was juicy. The bun did not make it through the meal. The side salad was perfectly dressed and had really fresh greens. 

My son also had a burger with fries and the fries were well cooked and properly seasoned. 

Again the big plus to this place is that the beers are better, cheaper, can be put into a plastic cup to take into the stadium, and they have an entrance right in the back of the restaurant. The only caveat is that if it is a giveaway day, you do not get that item at this eneterance.
author: Fred T.

description:
We had the Impossible Burger ($14 each). You can replace the potato chips for fries ($3) and/or add bacon ($2). My Impossible Burger with bacon here was better than the Impossible Burger at Umami Burger.

I'd also highly recommend the Churros ($7) - they are very churros con chocolate a la Spain with dipping chocolate. Unfortunately, the dipping chocolate is a little sweet, but pretty close!

The ambiance is very bar. I'd recommend the outside space; the indoor space is a little dark.
author: Judy S.

description: Plenty of televisions to watch out of town games. Service is impressive given how slammed it can be on game days. If you want a table, you need to arrive early as people tend to camp out at the tables until just before game time. If you can't beat then join them. It's what we do, but we do keep ordering drinks apps etc. Beer selection is superior to inside the park. Comparatively less expensive than inside where the lines are longer as well. BIG BONUS  - You can take a walker straight to your seat if you enter through the gate inside the establishment. Be warned you won't get the give away if there is one. Bloody Mary was done well and the price wasn't bad for tho locale. Ended up having the huevos rancheros for breakfast and they were a solid foundation for around $10. This is a great add on to the rotation of pregame options for Giants games.
author: David M.

description: Can't give a review on their food as much as I wish I could, we came here on full stomachs to just have a few beers and watch the game. Good crowd, nice staff, good collection of beer.
author: Courtney B.

description: Great place to get an adult beverage while you wait for the gates to open to the park.  Shorter line to get into the park
author: Clay H.

description:
Connected to the Giants Stadium. This place was more of a bar than restaurant. 

Went on a Saturday afternoon. Service was slow but friendly. 

Pricing was high for bar food. Food flavor wasn't anything to rave about.
author: Grant B.

description: We had a great time here. The staff is super friendly and the food was good! It is a good price for the location, good place to hang out and have a beer before the game.
author: Manda M.

description:
Came EXCLUSIVELY for the impossible burger. Good call to come mid-day on a workday and grab some grub! My 2 coworkers and I got an appetizer of some onion rings to start and then we each got the impossible burger. I had SUUUUPER high expectations.

Our burgers came out and the moment of truth!..... drumrolll......... okay, issall good. It was good :) but not GREAT. maybe it was a little over cooked or something? I don't know... but it wasn't bleeding like you hear about the impossible burgers to do. As I was eating it, it was good, seasoned well, solid food... but something about the burger (and I'm sorry in advance if this ruins it for anyone) but it really did remind me of like a well seasoned and well ground up... cardboard. Maybe it was the overcooked texture, again. Or maybe just in that moment... I don't know.

However, before you freak out, I would for sure give this place a second chance. The venue itself is a GREAT sports bar, with tons of seating and TVs. the bar food seems solid and prices are right. I'll give this place the benefit of the doubt and probably go back soon to try again (except this time, I'll be clear about how the burger will be cooked, if possible).

Good eats overall but waiting and hopeful for the second time around!
author: Nerissa C.

description: We were excited to come here before the Giants game, held on a Saturday night. It took a very long time to be greeted, and even longer for them to take our order and have our drinks delivered. We were there 4 hours before game time and our server was all by herself with 8+ tables. They don't carry energy drinks so I couldn't get a Red Bull vodka. 2 stars for the location. Didn't have any food, just drinks. Not a large selection here.
author: Lindsey V.

description:
Wow great food and service !  I was very pleasantly surprised as the location (next to AT&T Park) made me think it would be a tourist trap but No!  
We sat ourselves and were immediately greeted and ice water poured for the group. Our waiter (don't remember name, but slender male with long ponytail), told us right away that only two orders of fish and chips were left, so he reserved those for us while we pondered the menu. 
We ordered wings, nachos, Cubano sandwich, and burgers along with the fish and chips. Every item was fresh, delicious and served fast!  Our waiter was very attentive, and continually kept our drinks filled. Overall, this restaurant was excellent and I look forward to a repeat visit!
author: Jennifer R.

description: Good beer. Bartenders know their beer. Great place to watch sports (especially during the offseason)
author: Jacob B.

description:
Came here before the game last night to grab a few (regular priced!!!) beers and bites after seeing some reviews that we could walk into the park from here... and with beers!

Lived here my whole life and only just went to my first home game last night... x_x don't hate me. But, I'm glad as a newbie that I discovered this little beer tip to save $$$$.

My friend and I got in after the quick moving line (bag checks) and waited at the bar for about 5-10 minutes before we were served. I got a Lips of Faith Blackberry Barley Wine and my friend got the Russian River... something... forgot what it was. Great taplist and bottle list!

We decided to stay for some food and went into the dining-only area. Plenty of spots left, since everyone was crowding towards the park entrance. This is when we realized we could have ordered beer at our tables instead of standing around for our to go cups (since we weren't going in yet...).

A waiter came by shortly after we sat and happily took our order. I noticed that the employees here are very grounded during a busy game night! Like they seem happy to be here, which is so rare these days to see in food service lol.

I ordered the nachos (veggie - $11) and friend ordered the mac and cheese (which was off of the kids' menu and not on the regular menu - $6). My nachos were surprisingly good. Nice and salty and crunchy with plenty of toppings. I didn't expect much since it was so busy haha.

Would definitely be back for the beer-into-game situation! Grabbed another before we went into the park. Definitely saved ourselves like.. at least $10 from not buying those $12-18 beers in the park!!! Stock up on your craft beer needs here before entering the park. It's WORTH IT.
author: Shanise M.

description:
Love that this place is right outside/next to AT&T Park. It's a nice bar/restaurant however, seating is limited, especially after a game. 
Anyways, the staff is nice and polite. I was a bit hesitant that we wouldn't be reached because you walk in and seat yourself (which i thought would make the wait staff work a little harder than usual because they'd have to keep up with who was coming in and out). 
The burger and the sandwich that we had gotten were perfect! Portions are great because my boyfriend and I were full leaving just a couple bites left. Everything tasted so fresh and prices are moderate for the city. We will be back.
author: Janine C.

description: A bit pricey for the quality of food. Had the Impossible Burger with fries and it wss easy $20. It was great or anything to come back for. Have to race to get a seat once it comes available. Its basically a bar with finger food with the typical ball park prices.
author: Peter N.

description: As a Dodgers fan, I should hate this place being at the AT&T park. As a San Diego resident, I should hate this place being at the AT&T park. Was waiting out the rain and had a couple beers and realized most of the taps are Ballast Point beers. They even have Russian River Consecration on draft...even though it ran out before I got there. The service was friendly and the set up of the bar is good. I'll be back one day to watch the Dodgers win.
author: Sunny W.

description:
Because the burger really was that good.

I rarely go to AT&T Park for obvious reasons (Go A's) but when I do (because they're probably playing the A's), I'm sure to stop by Public House.

I went for SF Beer Week with a friend. We chose to go here because we wanted to celebrate beer week but also be able to watch the AFC and NFC championship games. 

Me being an early bird, showed up when they opened. There was a wide selection of beers to choose from for beer week. The descriptions of the beers was lacking...and the bartender wasn't much help on learning about them for us to pick things we might like. 

Grabbed a couple of seats at the bar and enjoyed being able to watch the games. There's a lot of TVs so even us shorties can see, the crowd was chill (and into the game), and the burger I had was phenomenal. While I want to give three stars because of the lack of help from the bartender and the useless beer menu, that burger was juicy, full of flavor, and cooked almost to my medium perfection. Friend had he mini corndogs and the dipping sauce for corn dogs was sweet. It was not want he expected. However, the portion was pretty tiny - at 3. 4 would have been perfect. Flavor was good and the corn was on point.
author: Sierra R.

description: Awful awful terrible food such a great location but why can't they have decent food such a shame !! Don't go it's a waste of money or just get a drink !! Come on get it together
author: Catalina D.

description: Public House does not really need any more rave reviews, but I just can't help myself!! I LOVE this place! It is such a fun pre-game venue, even if you aren't going to the game! The vibe is upbeat and friendly and everyone is in a good mood, especially the bartenders Marshall and Frank! The bar food is also yummy, in particular, I'm a fan of the pretzel bites, onion rings, and nachos!! The option of going through here with a drink to the game is also a great idea!! Enjoy!
author: Sheila K.

description: The service is excellent. We were in a rush and or waitress, Aubrey, made sure our order came out quickly. The food was excellent, too!
author: Jed S.

description:
I came here for lunch on this day with a few coworkers from out of town who wanted to try the Impossible Burger (yes they have it). Having had it before, I ordered the Chicken Sammich ($14) instead. 

The waitress asks me if I want chips or fries with it. I ask if it possible to substitute for a Side Salad. She says, "Sure!". At no point did she tell me that it was going to be an extra $3, and that I wouldn't get my chips (that comes free with the sandwich).

So I end up getting a tiny sandwich (sans chips), and a side of a few salted greens with some oil on it... for $17! I don't even know why I tipped the waitress 20%! This place is far too expensive for what it is. Flavour was good, and that's the only reason I am giving it 2 stars.
author: Anthony A.

description: Came here for their cask beer which was decent and cheap. Food was overpriced but what can one expect when you're literally next to the park. Place was empty when we arrived since it was a non game night. Food was nothing special, probably be happier with a hotdog at the stadium.
author: Katrina L.

description: Great place with real food! It was fresh and cooked perfectly. Would come again! Taylor was good!
author: Kristina O.

description:
Interesting experience today at the Public House. We've never been for food, only pre-game drinks, so after our Giants Race today we decided to visit for food and drinks. Walking in the sign said 'seat yourself' We found a table kind of in the back and was ignored for quite awhile. Until a very nice gentleman asked if we were being helped (I'm assuming he was the manager). He took our Oder and our drinks came super quick! Only highlight of this visit. 

Shortly after we noticed the bar tops cleared out and being that the Giants game was in in 20 minutes, we wanted to move. A woman came over and said she would be helping us going further. When I asked if we could move, she kind of got an attitude but asked if we'd cash out. I did and tipped her 20% despite her not being present for us.

We moved to the bar and the bartender was super grumpy. We already had our drinks but I knew I would want a beer next. I heard tell the guy next to us, rather rudely, that he would need to order a beer from the bar behind us. He did not explain why. The guy got a beer, his food and left quickly.  Apparently the tap lines were broken at the main bar, so the only draft beer was at the beer bar behind us. But if you had a tab open you had to go get your beer separately and pay separately to have a beer. Which I did and was rude experience #3.

I wanted a light beer, the Kolsch, which was on the bad taps. I asked the guy at the beer bar for a suggestion and he said the beers are listed on the board. They were, but by name. When I asked what the Field Works beer was he sarcastically told me it was a sour. I settled for an Allagash cause it was the beer I knew and I did not want anymore attitude.

We will never come here again! It was not even that busy and it was a miserable experience!
author: Jennifer D.

description: First time I've ever had a impossible burger. Very good! Even though I'm not a vegetarian, if I was, I could live in these things. So freaking juicy!
author: Samuel B.

description:
4/5: For great bar side service (though it did slow down a far bit as it got busier), reasonable prices, good happy hour, and reasonable portions. 

+1: What brought this place to a 5/5 for me is that they serve the Oakland based Impossible Burger-- it is a completely plant based burger that if you were not paying close attention you might think it is a real beef burger-- still different definitely, but a fantastic option for both meat-lovers and veg-lovers. Helps they just have good burgers and beer all around. 

Highly recommend stopping here, especially for the experiencing of trying the new Impossible Burger.
author: Chris O.

description: The impossible burger is incredible. You should come just to experience this high-tech burger. This burger has achieved singularity with beef. The fixings they provide here are very nice also.
author: Michael V.

description: The public house is an awesome place to grab a pre-game beer. My team at work came in particular to try the impossible burger which was an awesome experience! Tasty, delicious, by far one of my favorite vegan "burgers" I've eaten. To the point my coworker freaked out a bit that she might be eating actual meat (she wasn't).
author: Amanda Y.

description: This place is a chaotic mess!! There isn't a host/hostess so open seating can get "aggressive." People hover over the occupied tables waiting to pounce! I watched 2 different parties ask already seated guests if they could join them at their table. And seriously the food is just not good at all. My son's bacon was dangerously raw, my daughter's chicken sandwich was a dried up mess. I literally couldn't flag down a server to save my life, so we gave up...too crazy. Never again. They got 2 stars from me because our busser was actually helpful and friendly, and I love the Giants' themed atmosphere.
author: Michelle M.

description:
Great place to grab a beer, but I didn't try the food. Drink prices were a little much but not anything unexpected considering the location (attached to an MLB stadium). If you've got time to kill and want a selection of Northern CA's finest craft brews, stop by!

I was able to have a glass of one of my favorite all-time beers here, Russian River Brewing's Consecration. Definitely give this one a try if you get a chance!
author: Michael R.

description: Came to San Francisco on vacation with friends, on the weekend of June 1st. After a Giants game looking for a location to enjoy spirits and appetizers. Found this location. Came in has self setting. Non friendly server approached us, and quickly left. Not giving us enough time to respond. Then return and took drink orders. After submitting our appetizers orders. We asked for another round of drinks. She returned with a cold glass no drink. Seems like she was having a bad day. Soon after she said that she needed to close us out. Did not ask if we want another drink. I asked if we can close the door. Due to a  strong breeze. There was two other customer that needed to put on coats. We were enjoying are last beers and a server/busser came to my table and pulled the napkin off of table.  I had the napkin under my arm. Don't understand all the anger. Gave the establishment two stars. Because the food was descent.
author: Elizabeth F.

description:
Wow.  What a major disappointment.  As a long time Giants fan I always wanted to come here, and today was the day. 

The atmosphere is Great!!!  Love it, the TVs showing games, the entrance to the park, the vibe. 

The food however was bad.  Really bad.  I got the greasy fish n chips. Besides being greasy, the flavor was weird.  My son had it too and said it was fishy.  The fries were these tiny bits, seemed liked the bottom of the bag.  Even the tiny bits didn't taste good. I should have held off for garlic fries at the game. 

My wife had a burger cooked medium.  It looked good, still a little pink in the middle.  Then I tried it and it was so darn dry.  

I'm bummed.  Really wanted to love this place.
author: John C.

description:
For the 2 times I've been there after a Giants' game:

If it was service only, I'd give 5 stars.  The nachos were inedible!  And first I had to send them back b/c the beans were freezing cold!  The cook/chef should really taste the nachos and/or go try real nachos somewhere.
author: Dre C.

description:
I love this place, I haven't "checked in" as often as I actually visit. The extensive frequent rotation of taps and selection is great for beer lovers and connoisseurs. The bartenders and staff are wonderful, friendly, and knowledgeable. And you couldn't ask for a better place to have available before a baseball game thanks to their private ballpark entrance and option to take in one of their great brews. The food menu for lunch, dinner, or snacks are also really well done.

Despite this rave, I can't give it a full five stars because I've noticed during my few recent visits that the owners don't seem to be keeping the place up, which is a shame. Just today when we were in for lunch there was a noticeable lack of bar stools available, half of the bar (which is quite large and generally inviting) had practically no seating options! And a trip to the ladies room revealed a distressing lack of upkeep of the basics that one would expect to be provided with in an establishment of this kind. 

As a local, a fan, and a regular, I hope to see these signs of decline quickly remedied. Not just because baseball season is right around the corner, but also because I just really enjoy heading here for the great beer and service. It would be a real disappointment if it continues to not to live up to all it has to offer.
author: Lia B.

description:
I recently went to watch the super bowl with a group of friends. It was a great place, with good drink. The mimosas were good as well the margaritas and beer. The food we had couple of sides and appetizers they were good. The pulled pork sliders were delicious, a little spicy which gave a great taste. The sweet potatoes were good and crispy which is very hard to have crispy sweet potatoes.

I don't give 5 starts because of the fried mac and cheese. It was blend with no flavor. It was like eating a deep fried cardboard, no bueno. And the sound of the sport event. A place that is a sport bar in the ATT park, you would expect better sound and tv to show an event like the super bowl, but it wasn't. They need to improve on that as well.

But overall, it's a good place to crash and have a sport Sunday afternoon.
author: Patricia R.

description: I went here before a game and to be expected, it was crowded.  It is seat yourself and people crowd in with others and share the long tables.  I had the fish and chips, and it was okay.  The batter was not as crunchy as I like it.  It was on the soft side.  Nothing really remarkable about it.  The service was fine given that it was very busy.  I wouldn't go out of my way to go here for the food.
author: Mae I.

description: I tried coming here for the happy hour and was highly disappointed right off the bat. First of all, nobody came to greet me when I walked in or made any attempt at all to seat me. So I gave up, sat down on a table and waited. Now keep in mind the place is half empty and several waitresses walk past me and don't even acknowledge my existence. Then I waited some more. After waiting for 15mins (I've never waited this long at an empty restaurant before) I said screw it and walked out. I'll never be back here again and I'll definitely be spending my money elsewhere where they treat customers better.
author: Mohamad M.

description:
You know what you're getting with this type of connected-to-a-sporting-arena bar and restaurant. Solid burgers, if slightly overpriced, and a good bar menu, again overpriced but hey, you're going to a Giant's game and are in one of the most beautiful cities on Earth. I can't drink beer, but my whiskey Diet Coke was pretty mediocre here so maybe go with a wine or a cider. 
Bonus points for the entrance into the park directly from Public House, which will let you bring your beer with you as a +1.
author: Delaynie K.

description: We went to Public House today before the Giants game. I was shocked that so many outside table were available and we were served very quickly. There were quite a few drink selections and the service was great. For the location and the convenience the prices are definitely right. I highly recommend this place if you are going to a Giants game and want to get a drink beforehand. There is even an easy, direct entry into the game.
author: Nicole C.

description: Even though super busy Quick, excellent service. Bacon jam grilled cheese super yummy. Great burger!!!
author: Leanne F.

description: Tried the impossible burger here. It was over cooked and the bun/toppings were unremarkable. Onion rings had uncooked batter. Service was quite slow.
author: Marianna M.

description:
A chill place to come and have a beer. They have a pretty decent selection but I guess on random days of the week their more interesting drafts will be sold out. When it's slow, the servers are attentive and very friendly. 

Happy our is an okay deal, pretty decent for food. The nachos are pretty good. Nothing amazing, but very solid. Lots of tasty toppings on decent chips. 

On game day (since this is connected to AT&T park) this place is PACKED. But always a good place to grab a beer before a game or whenever. I probably come here before every game I attend. But like any crowded bar, be prepared to fight for the bartenders attention before a game. 

This is also the place to get a couple beers to bring into the game at regular bar price, since this venue is connected to the park, they have an entrance where you can actually bring in the beers purchased here.
author: Bryant C.

description: On game days these bartenders are fast and consistent, they will more pour you a stiff tito's n soda, will be glad to skip Pete's Tavern and come here instead. Also if you buy the beers or hard alcohol here and have your ticket already, they have a ticket taker with their scanner to let you enter the stadium with your drink in hand, so make sure you're double fisted. =)
author: Andrew Z.

description:
Would get a better review if the service was not so shoddy. Started at the bar with drink orders, the bartender who clearly wanted to be somewhere else, had a bad attitude and a lack of knowledge of the brews on tap, he had to call a waiter over to help. 
Once we were seated our waiter, who had to mention he was in a band (Ooh cool, are we in LA or San Francisco?) Got completely overwhelmed by small changes to the order, had a tizzy fit melt down and had to start again. The place was relatively empty so this guys career as a server is not looking good.
In the end we ordered appetizers, telling him we'd lock down our mains shortly. Appetizers arrived via kitchen staff but the waiter never returned, my wife had to track him down. The food was great, apart from the house fries, which have consistently been terrible and arrived cold. Impossible burgers were awesome best we've had so far.
The first time we went to Public house, the staff were awesome, knowledgeable and friendly. Dunno if this was an off night, but definitely would make me think twice before going back.
author: Darin H.

description:
My company came here before a Giants game to relax and have some fun before we watched the game. This place is really fun, but you also have to take into consideration that it is a fast paced restaurant. You also have to go into this restaurant knowing that it is slightly upscale bar food. Don't come in here thinking that it is going to be quiet and 5 star food. It simply isn't. It's just a good fun time.

I ended up ordering the Baked Mac and Cheese. It was rich, creamy, and a little bit too heavy, but it definitely hit the spot. It had the perfect blend of 3 different cheeses, but I wish there was some bacon on it too. I mean, if you are gonna order a heavy mac and cheese, you gotta just go ALL THE WAY. We also ended our meal with a Ballpark Brownie Sundae. It was pretty good, but WAY too thick and rich. The brownie was a little too hard for my liking, but overall wasn't too bad.

Whenever I am going to the game, I will definitely be back here for a few drinks and some yummy bar food.
author: Theo T.

description: Great beer selection, nice ambiance, good food, and awesome location! Attached to AT&T park, this is a great location: crowded around baseball games, but pretty chill otherwise. It's a classic sports bar with a great selection of beers on tap AND fancy/obscure beers by the bottle (mostly larger bottles). The menu isn't huge, but it's got a fair number of options. I got the Cuban sandwich and it was pretty big and tasty and I definitely want to try more of the pub-style food on their menu. Service was good, prices were a bit high, but otherwise a solid spot that I'll definitely come back to!
author: Jeffrey S.

description: This probably my favorite place to get a few beers before Giants game. Classic stadium adjacent sports bar that gets you in game mood. Fun staff and lots of great beer choices.
author: Brian A.

description:
Pricey bar scene, but rightfully deserved, since it is connected to the AT&T ballpark and that surely demands or draws a crowd here! 

They have grand selections of beer, cocktails and wine as well as savory bar bites, such as chipotle chicken wings, garlic fries, sandwiches and signature burgers!  Public House is a hotspot when there is a SF Giants game and the place hosts a nice pre-game spot - especially before going to the stadium that is right next door!  They offer up brunch entrees too - starting at 11am and only on weekends!  

It is a spacious Public House, with communal tables and servers are quick with getting food and tab out.
author: Tiffany D.

description: Just came in and had the worst service! Our bartenders name was "Crystal 8003" she was not welcoming and was annoyed we sat down. She was to busy flirting with some guy and didn't even want to help us! I'm sure I saw an eye roll! Make sure she's not working or flirting if you expect service.
author: Joe M.

description: This place is awesome. I went in with my dad to get some food and beer before the giants game. Even though it was busy we got our beer and food pretty  fast. Their chicken sandwich with avacado and blue cheese is the best. Being able to enter att park from inside the restaurant was really cool and convenient. Only downside is they don't serve Coors light.
author: Zack M.

description: Great environment for a Giants baseball game. Lots of beers on tap. On the contrary, the servers weren't very knowledgeable about beers and didn't even know what an APA was. Other than that the place had a good vibe.
author: Kyle T.

description:
I prefer Momo's over the Public House because they offer more food and are less insanely crowded on game day. However, Public House is an awesome hang out with a nice selection of beers. Very pricey as it's attached to AT&T Park, but it's San Francisco and everything is pricey here. Always a cool place to hang out with other Giants fans before and after a game. 

Reminders: You CAN enter the ballpark through the Public House, especially if you don't want to stand in line and wait....

BUT if you want a GIVEAWAY you're not getting one if this is where you choose to enter. You have to go through one of the four main gates.

DO TRY: The onion rings and the fries. Bloody Mary drinks here are also quite tasty. YUM.
author: Jenny P.

description:
We came here to grab a bite before the game started. You come in, seat yourself and a waiter will eventually come by. Yes, eventually. Maybe our waiter avoided us because we were Padres fans. 

Pulled pork sliders - this was so good! I'm sad it came with three mini ones but the flavor was delicious. The meat was tender. The slaw on top had a great creamy taste to it. The buns were soft. I could eat 10 of these.

Fried chicken - this was just alright. The breading was light and flakey which we liked. But, there was not much taste there. We had to really use their ranch to get some flavor. 

Corn on the cob - Yum! You can't really mess up corn. This was super sweet. 

If we lived in SF, we would come here often!
author: Kristine T.

description: Well, after a hiatus of a few months the deep fried pickles are back !  Ummm ... can we have the other ones back, please ?!?  Missed the others, but these were a big disappointment -- pickles were soggy - far from crisp - and worse yet, the crust was not covering all the pickle (one had 1/3 of pickle uncoated!) and the others had a large percentage with cracked coatings (which fell apart as you attempted to dip or eat them) or coatings with missing patches. Mind you, in the "old days" the coatings were uniform in depth of coating, no open areas or cracks, and were uniformly golden - not splotchy, like these. Unsure what's happened but please correct this soon !! I need my pickles !!  On the next page, if you haven't tried the Impossible Burger, do so at least once! This burger is new, meatless and made across the bay, but only found in about a dozen places across the USA - 2 of them in SF, and here is one of those places. Read more about it (after you try it - too technical to help the appetite) and enjoy what we veggies (and vegans) have been missing for so long ! The "meat" is tasty, juicy, hearty in texture and a true delight. You'd be surprised - as will your omnivorous associates. They need to try it as well ... comes with side of house made potatoes chips.  Service still good and attentive, nice atmosphere - bring back my old pickles and we'll pretend none of this happened !
author: Mark K.

description:
The best thing about Public House? Location! LETS GO GIANTS!

Pretty decent local beer selection and very kid friendly. Root beer for little Giants Fans, real beer for big Giants Fans!
author: Bentley P.

description: Food was AWESOME and the service is equally as spectacular. I ordered the muscles and clams which were fresh and cooked to perfection. Our waiter was so kind to our 7 year old son and gave him a box of crayons to color the two SF Giants pictures. Great experience!!
author: Rizzy B.

description: Management's name is Nick. He stands around texting behind the bar, leans along railings just watching everyone but doesn't help out himself. The bathrooms are a mess. Broken toilet paper dispensers, paper towel dispensers don't work. Bathroom locks are glitchy. Like don't stand around staring out windows when there is plenty of work to be done. He walked by several times and I never saw him talk to customers to even ask how they enjoyed their meal or their experience. When I came in with my boyfriend to order food he stood right in front of us on his phone and never acknowledged us. Terrible manager.
author: Brittany L.

description:
I loved it here! We only ordered the pretzel with cheese and the tomato bisque soup, but those two items alone were killer!
The pretzel bites were made with this dough, almost like a donut. It was sort if sweet and soft and ABSOLUTELY DELICIOUS. Seriously, we were craving more. The tomato bisque soup was also wonderful, nice and creamy, but not too rich. It was even served with a grilled cheese! How can you go wrong with that combo?! I wish we lived closer, this would be our go to spot before any game day!
author: Lindsay L.

description: Fun place to grab a drink to pregame before the baseball game! The vibe here is good with friends and a good game going on. I met up with a few friends here before going to the game and it was beyond pack. Only had drinks here, but they do sell food. Will come back here to try their food next time. I recommend Giants fan to come here for a nice cold beer for the game starts!!
author: Danika P.

description:
Love this place! 

Service was stellar and the food was delicious. 

Sweet potato fries were perfect 
The fish and chips were nommy 
nachos yes yes yes!
author: Vicky T.

description: The food here is super yum! Ordered sweet potato fries and pork chop. Both were yum! Also, the bartenders here are real gentlemen. I came in with a group of 30 coworkers, and all bartenders were very attentive to our group. They were nice and even cracked jokes!! I would totally come here again.
author: Monica V.

description:
Me and my brother stopped in on the way for a tour of AT&T Park

Good food and nice atmosphere 

Maybe a good alternative if the Giants game is sold out
author: Kevin C.

description:
Came here mid-week,. 3 hours before first pitch and the place was jumping . Its open seating so keep on the balls of your feet! Was lucky to find a table quickly, but expect to wait 10-20 minutes if you come on a game day. 

Started with the Chipotle buffalo wings plenty flavorful and solid. Then the house made onion rings which was the star of the night. Not too greasy and not to thick where one bite is all onion.. Our waiter was attentive, genuine and was knowledgable about the entire menu. 

Cool atmosphere before games, reasonable prices, the wait may be the only qualm. I will look to come back on a non game-day for their happy hour.
author: Mias R.

description: As a Giants fan this my go to place! Love the bartenders! Great beers on tap! The food is awesome! What more can you ask for?
author: Ryan S.

description: Massively busy on a game day but great to grab a drink before the game. They even have their own entrance to the ball park but it most definitely does get super crowded and I've seen some intense fights break out, but I suppose alcohol, sporting rivalries and packed in bodies will foster that kind of behavior. On the other hand, non-game days this place is dead and you can have some good banter with the bar staff.
author: Sarah S.

description:
I honestly usually go here during games, and am always shocked that the prices are decent. You would expect them to increase the prices, but the food and beer was decently priced and pretty good! 

The best part about this is and you can enter the stadium from the side entrance and bring your beer with you in a to go cup (aka you are not spending a ridiculous amount of money paying for beer in the stadium).


I try to come here when I want to bring beer into the stadium, but honestly, it is just an average bar. I would recommend it, but I would also say there is nothing too special about it.
author: Umang P.

description: The beer was good, food was only ok.  Went on Tuesday and got there at 3:00, plenty of time to relax and enjoy meal and a beer.  Great selection of beer, good food selection but the food did not impress. Disappointed with food since it seems had so many great reviews.  Chicken nachos, sweet potato fries and chicken sandwich were only ok. Also, had to get a waitstaff person to find our waitress so we could pay the bill. Go for the beer, skip the food.
author: Jane D.

description:
I really wanted to love this place but I don't. 

The atmosphere and set up is really nice and the service is great but I did not like the food.

I ordered a bacon jam sandwich and it had a weird flavor I can't explain. Like chili but with sugar? Doesn't make sense but it just did not sit well with me. 

My dad wanted the nachos but asked if he could replace the chicken with steak and they said sure, but the server came back and said that we would have to purchase a $20 steak to add to the nachos that we would also pay for yet it would be served separate. We said no because that was just weird and extra. 

My sister had the fried chicken which she liked but her mashed potatoes were cold and I hate having to ask for the cooks to warm food up when it should come out hot and fresh.

I most likely won't be back but if I do, I'll play it safe and order a side of fries but I'd rather eat in the park as both foods are overpriced.
author: Leslie J.

description: Thomas is an amazing server. He's been the best part of our time here. The Ballast Point Kölsch is perfect for a game day  brew! It's pretty much paradise coming in to start out your SF Giants game day experience! Nick was also super nice to us when we tried to find a place to sit. If you don't get the mac and cheese fritters and the mini churros you are depriving yourself of joy and happiness.
author: Tracy T.

description: This place is awesome! Go to this bar before the game or after! But it is very tight and body to body so getting a drink can be a while but definitely worth it I always get an IPA and then go enjoy the Giants play -- i wish this was still called 24 in honor of Willie Mays
author: Addison M.

description: We stopped in before we headed home to Sacramento.  We found convenient parking across the bridge off 3rd Street because there were no games or events at the Park.  Easily found a table and were attended to by a friendly waiter.  My husband spotted fish and chips on the menu.  The waiter highly recommended the fish and chips because the cod is locally sourced.  All three of us decided to order it.  The meals arrived and looked appetizing however the coating was under done and doughie.  Not crispy at all.  We should have sent it back. The french fries were fine.  The tartar sauce was a bit off.  I would suggest ordering something else on the menu.
author: Elizabeth D.

description:
Came here on a Saturday afternoon with a large group and was very impressed with the prompt, attentive service that we received. I had been here a few times before, but had never eaten, only patronized the bar.  Food was tasty, but the service is what really stood out. 

I had the Cuban Sandwich and also got to try the Fish and Chips, both were good, and what you would expect in an establishment like this.  Beer was cold, which is always important and was served in a iced glass, just how I like it. 

Will definitely be back!
author: Heather K.

description: I have spent over $200 dollars and they refuse to allow two extra buddies of mine inside because they are filled to captivity yet I have never here for way more people in giants games lame place full of BS not worth money or tip....terrible place with terrible service and a rude general manager
author: Nerissa L.

description:
Honestly, I just walked in here to enjoy a beer while my girlfriend was in the bathroom. The bar smelled like vinegar/bleach, the bartender did not come to take my order for about 8-10 minutes, and his beer recommendation wasn't that great. 

There was about 5 people in the whole bar/restaurant and when I asked the bartender about the beers he recommended, his answer was "I don't know, try this one". I am from San Diego, and have tried all of the Stone Brewing Co. beers and other crafts, and I was recommended a Coors light. I felt uncomfortable in this bar and honestly felt as if the bartender just wanted to sell me more beer or food just to get me to pay more due to their lack of customers during that time. 

This is probably a cool place to be during game days, but apparently during non-game days, this is definitely not the place to be.
author: Melvin M.

description:
A massive meeting place before a Giants game and conveniently connected to the park (yes, you can bring your $11 Margarita there!), Public House served its purpose for our group.

Skip the pork sliders, but get the mini corn dogs.  Peteo tried to order an Allagash white and then a Henhouse Saison, but they were both out. Why?! stock up on game days, because you would expect popular choices to run out. 

Ok service, but I'd rather pre-game somewhere else.
author: Janice C.

description:
My rating is purely for the beer selection and the bartenders.  One of the best Tap selections in SF below Market st, and they are constantly rotating 1 barrel at a time; most of it stuff you'll have a hard time finding elsewhere.  Good bottle selection as well.  

The bartenders are fantastic.  If you come by during Giants games you'll notice how they get to everyone in an orderly manner.  They know their beer to. 

Couple pieces of advice:  

1) Don't go before Giants games unless you're prepared for a crowd; don't go after unless you're prepared for a really drunk crowd.  If you are going to the game, then by all means be sure to go an bring in a great beer into the park.  You can come back and re enter during the game as well. 

2). Don't eat here.  If I added in food into my rating it would drop to a 3.  Most food seems to be prepared and frozen ahead of time.   They really don't care to excel in this area.
author: Drew M.

description: Food was good but the service wasn't the greatest. We had to wait forever to get drinks even to the point where we had to go up to the bar to order our drinks and the place was nearly empty. They also charged us for a small side of ranch. So lame. I would only go here for HH but that's it.
author: Christian V.

description:
Game on! Good spot for pre-game hangout and drink. And eat. And mingle. 

Prices are expensive but drinks (beer, wine, cocktails, MOCKtails) come in fast. One nice thing is that you can take your drink into the AT&T park as Public House has a direct entrance into the stadium.

Nice interior - brick-exposed walls, large TV screens, modern. Kinda what you would expect from a sports bar. Outdoor area, two very large rooms.

I'll be back here for another game night, but I'll start saving my bucks right now.
author: Sebastian F.

description:
Most people come here to pregame before a Giants game and that's probably why you'll be downing $7 beers here too, which is a few bucks cheaper than drinking in the ballpark.

Best part of it? You can bring your beers to go into the ballpark so if you're really adamant on having a sloppy good time, double fist it. There's also a speedy separate entrance into the ballpark, skip the lines.

Lots of bar space & standing room, even when it's crowded it's not too difficult to grab a drink. Also recently ordered some wings to go, came out a bit dry. Shrug, it's pub food.
author: Steven C.

description: Great customer service and food. Place is a seat yourself restaurant. Waiter was super patient with taking our orders. Ordered the chicken bacon sandwich ($14) and blushing giant drink ($11). Sandwich came with a side of chips. Sandwich was small but was very good. I'm not a fan of strong alcoholic drinks, so the blushing giant was perfect. It was sweet but you could still taste just enough alcohol. Prices are reasonable. Setting is causal and dim lighting near the bar area. Television screens throughout the restaurant.
author: Sue L.

description:
The bf and I came here to wait for the Giants game. Pretty good location since it's RIGHT next to the stadium. We decided to grab a beer or two before the game. Because it was the day of the 2-for-1 Virgin airline voucher, the place was packed with fans grabbing drinks before heading to wait in line. We were stuck sitting outside, in the, surprisingly, hot ass day in the bay. Shana, if I remember correctly, was our server. She was SUPER friendly!!! Loved her! Since my bf and I aren't big beer fans, we asked her what was good. She recommended the Victor ale (?). She said it was sour, but I couldn't taste the sourness. It was good! I got Sam Smith's Nut Brown. That one was okay. Not a beer person, so it tasted like regular beer. She also told us about their baby back ribs special. It came with coleslaw and corn bread for $18. My bf saw the people next to us who got that dish, and decided to get it to share. When the plate came, whoa! It totally didn't look like the plate next to us! It was small! The plate was big, but the meal itself was small.

What I did like about the dish was that the meat fell right off the bone! The meat itself could have been better tasting. To me, it was on the bland side. There wasn't enough BBQ sauce on it. I like it saucy! The coleslaw was okay. Had more onions than I would have liked, but whatever. The cornbread was also on the eh side. Not sweet, not the right texture. I like it crispy on the edges and soft on the inside. It was just soft all over. To me, the meal wasn't worth the $18. We coulda went to Safeway and spent $10 on something bigger and tastier. Oh well.

Overall, I guess my experience here was okay. Aside from the okay food and hot ass day, this place is cool to grab a few beers before the game. Shana was awesome! Super nice! She also recommended us this tattoo place where she got hers at. Might check that out too someday!
author: Kristen B.

description:
WAY OVERPRICED! The decor is nice and modern. The location is excellent. The beer is almost double what you would pay anywhere else for comparable beer. 

The food is average to below average with nothing very unique on the menu. Appetizer chicken wings are $13 for 8 small, shriveled, previously frozen, wings.  Pork Potato Skins are $10 for 2 small white potatoes. Nachos are $10 for a small plate of disgusting looking food. They  skimped on the cheese, as well as all other toppings and the presentation looked like a homeless person took a dump on some tortilla chips. 

After the appalling appetizer experience, my friends and I decided to pass on trying any of their entrees. 

The service was decent but you definitely get the feeling that they are all about table-turn-over and could care less about the customers' experience. 

It wasn't what I'd expect, given that it is in a world class ball park. They're quick to take your money, but you don't get much in return. There are too many better places in the area for anyone to want to spend their money and time eating bland, un-appealing food at Public House.
author: Mark H.

description:
Public House is a nice stop before or after the game to enjoy some appetizers and beers.

We went after a game and the place was packed. Their wings are solid and they have a nice selection of craft beers. Everyone was friendly, even with us wearing our Dodgers gear. I'm sure we will stop by next time we are in town for a game.
author: Jim G.

description: Read about the great food, but will never find out because service is non existent. Came in during happy hour for the Reds game, got outside seating, and watched as two waitresses sneeringly walked past us while trying to get their attention. We left after another group sat down and were immediately serviced. 2 stars because it's a few steps to AT&T Park, but if you want to eat and drink, go somewhere else.
author: Manny A.

description:
I came here with my bf one night to watch the Giants game. We sat down at one of the round bar tables by the TV's. A waitress took our drink orders and we also ordered some sweet potato fries. The service was good, but I kept getting so distracted because the TV's were showing the same game on different networks.

Solid place for a game environment without ballpark prices and crowds.
author: Leana L.

description: Disappointed with the service here  I'm usually so excited to eat and drink here but this past Wednesday 5/24 the service was terrible. Didn't even acknowledge our table so we had to go to the bar to order drinks. Still kept ignoring us so we had to get a second drink from the bar. Finally the server came up to us after we flagged him down. I know it's busy, but please be aware of your section/tables! I love this place and wish the service was up to par.
author: Erika K.

description:
This place is one of my favorite things about AT&T Park and going to Giant's games. 

Getting a table can be difficult in the couple of hours before a game, obviously. It's self seating and I would never try to go here with more than 4 people on a game day.  

Once you get a table, the beer and cocktail selection is crafty and interesting.  Lots of choices of tapped beers and unique cocktails.  The food is equally great.  Fun ballpark food but a great step up from garlic fries and hot dogs.  

I had the veggie sandwich which was AWESOME! Over loaded with warm fresh vegetables served with a side of potato chips. 

The service is good, the servers are very busy but move fast and try to be as on top of everything as they can be.
author: Stephanie D.

description: Impossible burger is imposibly good! The guy that helped me was amazing. Recommended a great beer to go with the burger. I was there before the game so the place was not packed to the gills for once. All in all a great experience. I'd recommend this place to anyone, game or no game.
author: Woot H.

description:
Public House is THE place to go to before any Giants game. The food is not bad and a nice change from all the ballpark food we eat all the time, and the beer selection is ahhh-mazing... but you really want to come here before the game to grab a "to-go" drink!! That's right!! You can get two drinks "to-go" and bring them into the game. This is great because the prices for beer and cocktails at Public House are much better than the prices inside the ballpark.

As previously mentioned, the beer selection here is really really REALLLY good. They have your regular faves, but one of the bars has rotating taps that feature a lot of local micro-brew. The Flying Pig IPA seems a forever favourite and often runs out and they always seem to have one of my picks which is the Allagash White. I will say one time, I was tricked into getting a Coconut Curry Wheat, which was ok at first but later almost caused me to lose my lunch. (Curry beer should be banned!) The Bloody Mary is also very popular here, and I will say, it's one of the better ones that I have had.

If going here before a game, it is also important to note that during some of the more popular games and giveaways, Public House will either shut down access to the ballpark for 1-2 innings, or just be open and not have the giveaways. Be sure to read the signs before entering.
author: Bobbie L.

description: Super convenient, my beer was delicious but...the burger, yikes. 'Medium Well' does NOT mean 'Well'. It was so dry and overcooked. Wouldn't have been so bad except for the $16 price tag. It better be a juicy burger for $16 bucks. I would go somewhere else b4 getting food here again. (the chips were good).
author: Kathleen D.

description: Super Bowl Sunday - not an open seat but truly a bar that did not plan! Ran outa a couple beers before the game started. Some drafts not working, pork 'tacos' were horrible. Standing room only probably exceeding legal capacity. Probably a cool place to be at just not today.
author: Cyndi G.

description:
There are many things I miss when Baseball Season ends. I miss the players of course, getting all decked out in my Giants gear, the excitement of competition and going to the Ballpark. This is where I meet up with my folks and occasionally get to hang with the best bartender. 

Public House is not only the cornerstone restaurant, it's also a beer lover's paradise. Because what goes better with Baseball, than a nice cold beer. You can get a Racer 5 for $6.00, which is like 2-for-1 when it comes to the beer prices inside the park. 

These are a few of my favorite brews of the many they have on tap and in bottles. Why go for the average beer when you can try something new, delicious and with a high APV%. 

Draft Beers: 
* BEAR REPUBLIC RACER 5 IPA * 7.0% Healdsburg, CA
* SIERRA NEVADA TORPEDO EXTRA IPA * 7.2% * Chico, CA
Bottles:
* SAISON DUPONT * 6.5% * Belgium 
* ALLAGASH CURIEUX * 11.0% * Pórtland, Maine 
* WESTMALLE TRIPEL * 9.5% * Belgium 
* HITACHINO NEST WHITE * 7.5% * Japan 

If you want a little spin on the traditional Irish Coffee, try the Cafe Granada, with Flor de Cana Rum, Coffee, Brown Sugar Whipped Cream. It's really great and unique. Great for those cold San Francisco nights. 

Other than that the food is delicious, I try something new each time. So far, I've had the:
*Housemade Jalapeño Poppers, Tomatillo Salsa 
*Hand Battered Mini Corn Dogs, Spicy Mustard Dip
*Mac-n-Cheese: Mozzarella, Proovolone, Gruyere, Jack Cheeses topped with Mimmolette
*Public House Burger, Bacon, Avocado, Cheddar 
*California Cheese Steak, Tri-Tip, Smoked Gouda, Roasted Poblano Peppers, Caramelized Onions
* Pressed Cubano Sandwich, Roasted Pork, Niman Ham, Provolone, Gruyere, Pickles
*Sweet Potato Fries
and for dessert... the Ballpark Brownie Sundae, w/ Fluffer Nutter Ice Cream (Humphrey Slocombe), Chocolate Sauce, Kracker Jax. 

I absolutely love the Public House and will try and come back off season. This is a fun place to watch the game, drink quality beers and eat amazing bar food. See you soon!
author: Rebekah T.

description: Good beer selection but of course the food price is to high. Lol, of course because we're at at&t park.
author: Susan R.

description:
If you love the Giants as much as I do, and I mean LOVE as in true fan over 33 years win, lose, or tie from Candlestick to AT&T, then there's really nothing to explain here that hasnt' been said already.  The food is good, the prices are decent, the drinks are POTENT, and you always have a lively crowd during baseball season or not.

There's always action inside and out of this place.  The on-air commentators for live TV and radio certainly add to the appeal of the Public House.  Marty Lurie is definitely my favrorite of the bunch, because I am partial to those who practice law; we have a certain kinship... 

Come on over and treat yourself to a real SF experience and try the Public House, even if you're not going to a Giants game HUH?! SHAME ON YOU! Come on by for some good food, great atmosphere, awesome people to meet, and share some drinks with some new friends!
author: Myke Y.

description:
Came here on Friday night before the Cubs vs. Giants game ( T.T ) and it was crackin'. 

We arrived around 5:30pm and were easily able to buy some drinks after wiggling our way to the bar. I wanted to grab a bite, but most of the tables were taken and a few were marked "Reserved." After a couple drinks, we started to make our way to the park entrance and noticed the "To-Go" Bar. And was pleasantly notified that we could order food there and take it into the park. Yay! Drink prices are standard. Food is pricey. $15 for a burger and $6 for a small box of fries. 

Burger - BLAND! I smothered it in ketchup. Came with subpar chips. 
Fries - They were alright. Lightly seasoned. More gritty than anything. Smothered these in ketchup as well. You can get more fries at a fast food restaurant for less. 

The atmosphere of the bar itself is lively. Bartenders are friendly enough. I would definitely stop by again for drinks before or during a game, but this is mostly for convenience. The food is definitely not worth the price.
author: Dorothy L.

description: Great beer selection, mix of local brews, craft and California originals. Frank at The bar is friendly and good with recommendations.
author: Raul P.

description:
Came here for a quick bite before the Giants game. It gets really packed, so get here early to save seats if you are ordering food (some tables are reserved for diners only).

Ordered the chicken sandwhich and really enjoyed it. It was above average compared to chicken sandwhiches I've had in the Bay Area.

Fair warning, service is mediocre when it is super packed, but that can expected.
author: Jeff M.

description:
I came here with a couple of friends to drink. I really enjoyed coming here because it was something different and since it was next to a ball park. He told me that during the season that it was a lot more exciting and I don't think I would argue that. We kept it simple here, got a couple of loaded nachos and drinks while watching a game.

Inside, there are kegs or barrels (I don't quite remember) stacked upon each other making it look pretty massive and very decorative! Other notes were that there is plenty of seating inside and outside.
author: Bruce K.

description:
My first time at Public House was a good experience. Not being a beer connoisseur I wasn't sure which of the many beers on tap I wanted to try. 

Pros: Excellent customer service. Good food for the price. Great atmosphere. Good brews. Marshall, one of the guys up front was quite helpful, and with the place being relatively empty, he allowed me to try a few different styles before settling on a local stout. The guys seems quite knowledgeable and were more than willing to answer any questions I had. 

Cons: No real cons. But that could also be because it wasn't busy and it earlier in the day. 

If you lack the knowledge that I do about beer and want to maybe start to learn I think it's a good place. Or if you're you're near AT&T park, check it out. Especially if it's not a game day.
author: Ryan M.

description:
As the final food stop on the Yapsie SOMA Pupcrawl, everybody was excited to enjoy some snacks and beers.  When we pulled up, the side gate was wide open for us and we were greeted by the super friendly staff.  It was pretty clear that everybody loves dogs!

We started off with pitchers of local brews Racer 5 and Trumer Pils, which quickly ended up being quite a few more pitchers after that.  Not only did everybody love dogs, but the beers were crazy popular too!  We followed that up with some of their famous corn dogs which were delicious with the mustard sauce.  This was only a tasting, but I'll definitely be back during game days for a full order!

The event staff was super helpful and I'm really excited to go back and enjoy their puppy patio.  They even set out some water bowls for the pups and the patio offered great views of people watching on the beautiful day.  Luckily it was an off day for the Giants so the traffic wasn't too bad, but the area was still crawling with people, dogs, and of course Pupcrawlers.  I had a great time!

Food: 9/10

Service: 10/10

Price: $$

Atmosphere: 9/10
author: Joe M.

description:
Cool bar, nice location - super convenient before/during/after a game. Their beer selection was pretty good too - I was impressed both by what they had on tap, and what they had in bottles. Very obscure stuff - awesome!
The pretzel bites were ok, same with the corn dogs. I really liked the fries - very tasty.
author: Rich P.

description:
Awful!!!!   I know the location is great but don't waste your time or money here.  They don't even try to give you decent food.   Walk a couple blocks and you will get 10x better food.  

The beer selection is good but they are out of the better beers and be careful some of the beers are only 10 oz. but you are charged the same price of coarse.   Needless to say we won't go back.
author: Jeff S.

description: Public House can be a great place to watch a Giants game but avoid sitting at the bar. Why you may ask? Because the service is very very bad. They take forever and are grumpy to boot. Food wise, wings and fries are solid, especially during happy hour. They're beer list is also pretty good but each bar has different beers so be aware! Your beer order can take much longer if, god forbid they have to walk to the other side...
author: Marcia M.

description:
A Mexican girl usually never likes Mexican food if it isn't from Mexico or her own mama... but this Mexican girl right here... yeah, me! LOVED LOVED LOVED the Huevos Rancheros! ...at an all-American restaurant... who would have thunk?!

All staff was quick, polite and attentive.

GO GIANTS!
author: Yezel R.

description: Server thought i was trying to stiff him after i just paid my bill. When i asked for an explanation i was met with condescension. #sigh. Even after paying a second bill still no resolution. Maybe its me. Maybe. May. Be.
author: Anthony L.

description:
I came here for the first time on Monday for the Giants' Home Opening Day and I have been mad at myself for not coming in sooner. I usually go to a couple of games every season but I had just found out that day that I could bring my beers from Public House into the actual park. Complete fail on my part.

That being said - they have a good selection of beer at very reasonable prices. It was packed when we came in, but even then, it wasn't hard to grab a beer. Kudos to the bartenders! Definitely plan on coming back at my next home game and maybe try their food too.

It was packed with Giants fans so the atmosphere was great and the weather was nice as we sat outside on the patio. GO GIANTS!
author: Abby M.

description: Very poor experience. from ny came here for pre game meal Pricey and food wasnt that good neither of us finished One person ordered well done and medium well one came out rare one came out med rare. Service was good took care of our issue however
author: Brian K.

description:
As far as Public House's food goes...it's hard for me to say.  Yes, I was there twice over the weekend and yes, I did try a couple of things.  From what little I had, the Chicken Nachos were pretty good (the chips were crunchy) but didn't have a ton of chicken, while the Mini Corndogs were just okay.  However, it's safe to say I wasn't paying much attention to what I was eating (see below).  Considering we were a few rounds in, had been standing for hours (six hours total each night!), and were left to hold everything...I was just happy to eat something.

As far as being a sports bar though, Public House is pretty damn spiffy.  Plenty of beers on tap and several TV's hanging on the walls in every direction.  That, plus all of the people screaming, rooting, hollering, yelling, chanting, and cheering on the GIANTS made Public House a ridiculously awesome place to watch Games 3 and 4 of the 2012 World Series.  It was pretty cool how silent the place got right before Sergio Romo threw the final pitch, and even more amazing how loud it got when the crowd exploded with jubilation.

With all that energy in the room, being at Public House was almost like being at the game itself.  No joke, there were even lines just to use the bathrooms!  Hhopefully I'll one day be able to try their food, but I'll most definitely be back to catch a Giants game (or five).
author: Mike L.

description: This place is amazing not only are they incredibly attentive but even the manager came over with samples to taste and talk shop about the Giants I REALLY REALLY LOVE  this place.
author: Thumper E.

description:
Public house has a seriously good beer list, and the nachos are probably the best I've ever had. I haven't dined off the full menu.

Why only 3 stars? 

- I can't imagine coming here for any other reason than to pre-game before going into the ball park. As a ball park location it's kind of gourmet, but not enough to merit a visit ordinarily unless I was meeting someone traveling into SF on CalTrain and location was a factor. There are drinking options as good, or better elsewhere with preferable atmospheres.

- It's a $7+ beer. Which is great when you'll be paying $12 in the park, but not otherwise.

- I feel a bit bad writing this.. but the head barman at the craft beer bar makes it his thing to just either randomly serve who he pleases, or specifically skip people who've been waiting for a while. It happens every time I go in there, and not just to me, so I've concluded that a. it's not just me, b. he either does it deliberately, or the man lives in his own world and don't give a damn. AND he's slow. It's simply bizarre. I've given up on it now and just order a pint of Racer or Torpedo from the helpful servers at the regular bar.
author: Matt G.

description:
From their webstie: 

Public House Happy Hour 

Everyday the Giants are away from 4-6pm* 

$5 Well Cocktails & Select Drafts, & Wines by the Glass

$3 Cask Ales

50% off Bar Bites Menu 

Based upon my experience, avoid the nachos.  It would be great if they had better food options to pair with their beer.

Best thing about the Public House is that you can bring your beer(s) into the stadium during a game.  Save a bunch of money and avoid drinking a crappy beer.
author: Stewart D.

description:
I visited Public House last week for HH on a non game day.  Seeing that I'm not big on crowds this was the perfect time to go.  The plaza in front of AT&T Park was uncrowded, minus a bunch of corporate folks spilling out of tour buses being greeted by a flash mob of dancers...yeah, I don't know either.

We had our choice of sunny tables on the patio, which was perfect on that unusually warm day.  I always seem to get bad service when I sit outside but not at this place.  We had at least 2 different waiters & possibly a manager checking up on us.  Everyone was very friendly but not in a hovering/annoying way.  They took their time explaining the beers (we had lots of questions) & promptly brought our food & drinks. 

The happy hour prices here are great, although I think they are only on non game days.  50% off snacks like pretzel bites ($3), HUGE chicken nachos ($6), sweet potato fries ($3.50), or mini corn dogs ($3).  They also have $5 specials on drinks & some draft beers and $3 cask ales.  Nice!  

I know this place gets packed on game days, but I'd be willing to fight the crowds & have a drink or 2 here before the game.  Big bonus:  they have their own entrance to AT&T park & they let you bring your beers inside!  That's worth it right there to save a few bucks on the overpriced beer at the Giants games.
author: Erin S.

description:
THis place was okay.  We came here before the Giants game to get some snacks and just have some fun.  The food took FOREVER to get there.  There were limited vegetarian options.  They wouldn't make some items vegetarian because they were pre-made so that was limiting.  

The service was okay.  NOthing stellar.  I give the 3 stars for the atmosphere.  It's a fun and lively place and I really enjoyed the time here.
author: Sheena D.

description: Went here for happy hour and the drinks were really good. The deal was 5$ beers which is great and the bar bites was half off. It was really slow when we went in and only a couple of people eating. The service was really good with great recommendations.
author: Seleen T.

description:
A cool place to grab drinks after a Giants Game. They offer a great selection of beers on tap plus a full bar. I haven't tried the food but it appears to be your typical straight forward bar fare.

When the Giants are away they have a good Happy Hour going on so worth checking out the next time the Giants are away.

Overall Thoughts

Variety of draft beers, upbeat atmosphere, close proximity to Cal Train and Muni
author: Eddie W.

description: The bar can get raucous after Giant's games and other large events. This appears to make some staffers stress out. For example, yesterday's doorman Sonny acted like some OG tough guy. We walked in after dealing with his bad attitude, but decided to turn around and leave. Too many other more friendly places within walking distance!
author: Janet F.

description:
Not a bad place.

After spending hours on our feet coming back from a concert near by, we certainly had worked up an appetite for some good hearty food. Public House seemed to be our best choice with in our way back to our final destination.

Its your typical  modern, san fran, upper scale, sports brewery styled restaurant. Open spacious floors, high vaulted ceilings, dark hard wood floors through out along  with a nice  open view of the kitchen.

The place was pretty scarce, so we were able to seat our self's at a nice secluded table with a nice view of the kitchen. 

Our sever came to us promptly and handed us the menus.
