They have a minimum selection of items to choose from on there menu however, they all sounded quite appealing. They also have an excellent selection of some deliciously appealing beers to choose from however, I just was not in the beer mode this day : (

I decided upon there California Cheese Steak with Smoked Gouda, Roasted Poblanos, Onions  $15.50 and my hun ordered the Grilled Chicken Sandwich, Avocado, Bacon, Blue Cheese  $13.50 we also ordered a side salad for both of us.

The salad's came first, presented fresh and delightful. The only thing I was not aware of, was the cheese gonzola cheese and olives on it so, I just got another one without. Which was quite good.

Our meals arrived shortly after, presented delicious looking and generous in portion.

I took off the top bread and mostly had a the Philly meat, though it was quite tasty and unique with the poplano peppers giving it a nice kick. It also was quite filling.

My bf also really enjoyed his club.

Overall, the atmosphere is lively yet relaxing, the service was quite on par and friendly and the food was tasty and unique enough to have us wanting to come back.
author: Shannon H.

description: We came here a few house after the Giant's game. The place was not as crowded.  We had pulled pork sliders, which was dry and not very good. Onion rings were oily and not crunchy; the batter was okay though. Service was fantastic. The servers and busers were very tentative and professional. We even complimented them to the floor manager when we left.They brought out all condiments for us for the sliders, which we didn't use b/c it was pulled pork. There was no sauce for the onion rings so we asked for ranch. They charged us for $1 for 2 little sides of ranch. Just a dollar...but should have been apart of the condiments. Weird that we were charged for ranch at a restaurant LOL. Margarrita was super sour. I had to ask for ice and added salt to fix it myself. Beer from San Marcos was good. There were a bunch of flat screens for sports games.
author: Lorie N.

description: This place is too hyped up for what it actually is. We had the nachos, wings, fries, and fish and chips....EVERYTHING was nasty. I would not come back to this place for their food, only to watch a game on game days. The service was really good and the vibe is nice but other than that it was a no go.
author: PrabSimran B.

description:
There's something about beer and baseball that go so well together. 

Hearing that Public House has one of the largest draft beer (80% local) and cask ale offerings in SF, I came here with my friend Phil D. on an off day to watch the Giants play the lowly Dodgers. 

It wasn't busy inside but guess what? Public House was out some beers? The tap was decent so plan B worked and is it to much to ask to serve the beer colder or in a frosted glass? (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/wKa_E1SnjQxxEGBD4Opcvw?select=2gdgFhrSQFbm8e6-CMt-tw)

Inside it's more upscale with a good amount of plasmas with premier pub grub (crab cakes, deviled eggs, etc). Ordered a couple lamb sliders. Decent and flavorful but for 2 bite size sliders @ $10 bucks, I wouldn't call it Man Food. (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/wKa_E1SnjQxxEGBD4Opcvw?select=R3oLUIVQ7XLbiqEEEJKy8Q)

Public House is more on the Palomino, Tres Agaves, Paragon, and Momo's tier but for game day I prefer local favorite Zeke's around the corner to grab some nice cold ones.
author: Earl G.

description:
Date & Time:  Friday April 2, 2010 @ 4pm
Location:  Former Acme ChopHouse & Now Connected to Mijita
Dining Companion:  The Husband
Scene:  Mix of Happy Hour 20-30 Somethings in Diesel Jeans & Older Suburban Couples in Giants Gear
Vibe:  Chill
Decor:  Contemporary Pub.  2 Dozen Flat Screens Strategically Placed. Bar, Communal Tables & Cocktail Tables.  Exposed Brick Walls & Brown Color Palette Juxtaposed Against The Bright & Colorful Mijita 
Service:  Bright-Eyed & Bushy-Tailed Young Servers Clad Head to Toe in Black Long-Sleeved Public House Tee's, Jeans & Striped Aprons
Imbibe:  Trumer Pilsner Beer & Overly Tart Lemonade.  Full Bar Available
Devour:  Anthony's Cookies & Humphrey Slocombe Ice Cream Available
Mediocre:  Deviled Eggs, 4505 Hot Dog, Pork Slider
InEdible:  Onion Rings & Butterscotch Pudding
Total:  $46.12
author: Genevieve Y.

description:
3.5 stars - it's one of the better places around AT&T park.  There are two bars - one full bar and one catered to the beer drinkers...of course, we went to the one where they serve beer.  No stools, just park yourself and order away.  

Not a huge selection but enough variety to choose from.  What we had:
Blind Pig - $7
Marin O&B - $6
chicken wings - $11 - ok
deviled eggs - $8 - not bad, of course not nearly as good as Marlowe's or Park Tavern

You can order food from the Mexican restaurant next door.
author: Gloria H.

description: Get the burger with the fried mac n cheese add on or the churro waffles at brunch! Great place to pregame and postgame for the giants games.
author: rodrigo s.

description:
What I ate: Nachos, mini corn dogs, jalapeno chorizo popper
Visit date: September 14, 2012
First time? Yes.

Two stars for being too slow and too salty. The nachos disappointed. The chips, which I described as 'triple fried' were greasy. When the mounds of cheese cooled, you basically had one big hunk of nacho. The ratio of toppings to chips did not work out. The mini corn dogs were so cute, but over fried. The outside was hard; I couldn't eat it. The dog part was juicy, but salty. The jalapeno chorizo popper? Another grease fest. I really should give this place a one based on the food I had alone, but we'll go with two since I probably should have eaten the food with lots of alcohol (my bad).
author: Erin G.

description:
Man, the PUBLIC HOUSE place has so much potential...

The food, beers and prices are all right for the location. BUT, I can't tell you how much I hate the "free-for-all, no hostess, wrestle for a table" thing they've got going on. We actually ended up sharing a small table with another nice couple.

We got there almost to hours before first pitch, and all of the tables were full. So we kinda vultured in this one area, waiting to pounce on the next open table. Next thing you know, there are like three other couples doing the same thing - on our turf! Right about then, our new pals offered us a couple of stools and we gladly accepted. I bought him a brew, and we got along well. I guess it all worked out ok, but it could have been lame.

Anyway, I had three IPA's and we shared three apps. Warm Pretzel Bites (2.5 stars), Corn Dog Bites (4 stars) and Chicken Nachos (4 stars). 

I'd go back, but I prefer Pete's Tavern over this. Get a hostess and take back some control and this place could be 5 stars. Until then...

3.75 stars
author: Joel V.

description:
Conflicted.... Awesome lively environment (4 star) , food is just ok (3 star).

I tried the mussells and buffalo wings.  I found the mussels to have a bit too much of an ocean taste (didn't taste super fresh) and the bufallo wings didn't have much of a kick of anything (bland).  I even found the ranch dipping to be kind of bland.  

Sorry Public House.  I'll still keep coming back because I love the energy associated with the games, but the food isn't that great.
author: Jensen L.

description:
I hadn't been to Public House before as I definitely wanted to stay away during Giants games but we had a bunch of family in town and it was a perfect spot on a quiet Saturday night.  There was plenty of room for the nine of us as we were seated in the back of the restaurant.

When we ordered I was bummed that the two beers I wanted weren't available.  The house burger made up for it though.  With the bacon, cheddar and special sauce, it made me feel like all burgers should come like that.  The chips that accompanied it were really good as well.

Decent bar food as long as there isn't any Giants game.
author: Blake B.

description: F this place. Wanted an impossible burger. Went there not knowing there was a concert at the stadium - they were fairly busy. No hostess or anything to tell you where to sit etc - went to bar and waited a few mins to get a servers attention. Asked a server where I could order to go. She said any server and that she would be with me in a few mins - kinda rude. She finally got to me and told her I wanted to order an impossible burger to go. She said they can't do those to go for some reason and that I would have to order it there. She told me to do a a seat and order it. Found another server taking people's orders and told him I wanted to order - asked where I was sitting and told him I could sit anywhere - where can I sit? As there was no hostess and didn't know if there were community tables etc. He told me that he was busy and didn't have time to answers my questions- total a hole. I originally called the restaurant to place a Togo order but they never answered every time I called and it kept going to voicemail. The service here is atrocious.
author: Barthalemew C.

description:
Located next to the Giants stadium, you feel like you're a part of the game with a large flatscreen at every possible corner of this restaurant. Beers are more expensive but that's not really an issue.

I was more disappointed in the service and what the bartender recommended. I wanted to try something new and unique on their drafts list, but he eventually gave me Blue Moon and charged me higher for it...not sure how that happened. I would've ordered something else. However, that didn't mean I didn't have a good time and that I wouldn't come here again.
author: Ee Vonn Y.

description:
Went here before yesterday's game.  Talk about crowd surfing.  It was incredibly difficult to move around due to the sheer number of people they allowed inside.  I'm not sure what the 'limit' is but I'm convinced it was exceeded by dozens if not hundreds.  However, the staff was very friendly and fast.  Even the security guy was helpful providing traffic control.

Prices for beer and regular cocktails is less than the standard City fare however if you want premium spirits be prepared for a little sticker shock.  

It is nice that your bags are checked before entering Public House so going straight into the game from there is much easier with a shorter line and beverage in hand in a 'To Go' cup.  A bonus is the clean bathroom but then they are clean inside the ball park too.

The bartender said it was a slow day!?  He encouraged me to come when the Dodgers are in town if I wanted to see busy. NO thank You.
author: Sandyann G.

description: Came here to grab a beer before the game. It gets crowded so if you're trying to meet people up I suggest getting there early to grab a table(s). Bring friends to help you secure a table or else you'll get the stank eye from those who are waiting if you're solo. I ordered an IPA and nachos. The nachos were a good appetizer to start and share. The bartenders and servers were really nice, however it may be difficult to grab their attention sometimes due to how busy it is. Overall it is a fun environment to watch the game or pregame. However, it is super easy to get trapped aka getting too drunk to notice time, and you might end up getting inside the park during the 7th inning, oops.
author: Brigitte M.

description: Great atmosphere before the game. But the old white bartender with glasses that works at the small bar near the park entrance is so rude that she killed the buzz for my fiancé and I before the game. She was yelling at everyone to move away from her bar when that is where they tell you to line up to enter the park. Better figure it out!!
author: T R.

description:
Pregame ritual: grab an Allagash White on tap in a "to go cup" before heading into the ballpark from the entrance inside the bar. The food is ok, but why would you want to eat here when there's Crazy Crab'z sandwiches and garlic fries and Ghirardelli ice cream sundaes being served in the ballpark? The drinks are what gamers are really here for!

LET'S GO GIANTS!!
author: Joe N.

description:
Been to many Giants games at AT&T Park but finally ate here for the first time after yesterday's parade.  It was the perfect place to wind down, drink a few beers and look back at the SF Giants' winning 2012 Baseball Season while watching the Victory Ceremony on live broadcast  on a huge high def TV screen.

Food was great.  Service spot on.  Atmosphere was perfect: a winning atmosphere.

Cannot wait to celebrate here again.

Try the burger: it's very good.
author: Tony U.

description: Loved this place, great service i had the grilled chicken sandwich and was delicious, my husband had the chilaquiles & he loved them. Great hangout before the game! Loved the food and friendliness of the staff. Will definitely go back soon!
author: Maria G.

description: Place is chaotic, would not go back. I've been a Giants fan for years and have tried to go to at least one game a year as a special event. I usually eat at a restaurant before the game, usually not in the ballpark, and am always happy that way. This time we decided to try the Public House after years of just walking past it. Waiter was hassled, kept saying he was overwhelmed. My friend's hamburger was way undercooked and had to be sent back. My other friend ordered a beer and was told they didn't have it cold because one of their refrigerators was broken and had to order something else. Service was incredibly slow. Missed getting a bobblehead as a result. Food otherwise was passable, nothing special. Wouldn't go back.
author: Kevork A.

description: This place is much more bar than restaurant. They have a great beer selection but a pretty small food menu. The place is clean and the service is friendly. Ordered the cheddar bratwurst with kraut. Really enjoyed the housemade chips. Will happily be back.
author: Josh N.

description:
Public House is a great bar right in AT&T park.  I came here for happy hour work and it was a great place to meet up and hang out with co-workers.  The beer selection was diverse and unique as well as their happy hour deals (especially on their food).  We had the nachos at a discounted price and each shared a beer.  I was a little upset about the slow service and felt a little misled by the happy hour prices.  BEWARE, it may say that select drafts are a discounted prices, but really its only 1 or 2 beers out of the entire selection.  Nonetheless, I was not let down by the taste and quality!

I would definitely love to come back here during a game (instead of the off-season) and appreciate Public House in all its glory and splendor!!!!
author: Robert T.

description:
I think Yelpers, or maybe just San Franciscans in general are really hard to please.  I've been here numerous times now, and even threw our company holiday party here.  I've always had an amazing experience and the staff is super friendly and knowledgeable about the menu and plethora of beers they have.  Mijita next door is great too and have eaten their food in Public House - I've eaten there twice and thought it was great.  My one and ONLY complaint is that it can be pretty pricey - but I totally understand why - the rent ain't cheap in AT&T Park.  So, you're paying for the atmosphere I assume.  PS - the nachos are no joke.   More topping than chips - THAT... my friends, is LEGIT.    

Finally, if you ever need to throw an event here - I highly recommend it.  Ask for Nathan.  Super friendly and thorough guy.  You can even work out a deal to get ballpark tours which leave right from the restaurant.
author: Matt L.

description:
We came here after Snow Bomb, for some non-beer drinks (full day of beer tasting) and snacks.  We ordered pretzel bites, corn dogs, a Philly cheesesteak, and onion rings.  The corn dogs were basically a hit dog wrapped in a chewy corn tortilla, and somewhat fried.  Very disappointing.  The cheesesteak meat tasted funky.  Definitely not meaty.  Maybe it was meat at one point.  Maybe.  The onion rings and pretzel bites were harmless, but nothing to write home about.

The iced tea was good, though.
author: Anika E.

description:
Went during game 5 of the world series--probably the busiest time ever. I was surprised they were still letting people in considering I had to push my way to the bar. Yea, it was hot, stuffy, long lines, and crammed with people trying to find a place to put their drink down but the staff did their best to make sure people were able to order food and drinks. 

The nachos are dangerously good and they have a great drink menu. I'm not sure $20 is worth 2 beers...The Public House is as close as you can get to the action without actually being at the game. The crowd has always been friendly and overall a great place to enjoy the game!
author: Stephanie M.

description:
Disclaimer: this review is based on service and drinks only.

I was not expecting to love this place, but really enjoyed my visit here!  We came in on a Saturday night around 6pm (we had just missed HH - take note it's from 4-6pm).  

We easily seated ourselves in front of three TVs, so far so good.

Our waiter was super friendly, attentive, and knowledgable. Beer and margaritas were both really tasty, I would happily go back for these same drinks.  Awesome location right next to Giants stadium - I shall return!
author: Brianna M.

description: It's super packed but they are so attentive! And super fast! Wow! Imagine when it's not busy!! Good start for the night! Ready to see B and J!'
author: Jacqueline F.

description:
Pricey is the first thing that comes to mind. Ate here at the bar on a late Sunday night so I did not experience any crowd issues but I can easily see how this place could pack in people before during and after games. The pulled pork sliders with the slaw were absolutely delicious. The man seemed happy with his burger and pops seemed very happy with the fish and chips. French fries were tooootaly greasy though and seemed liked the bottom of the barrel so it was like larger hash browns rather than fries : / It was a functional meal but nothing really wowed me. The server was gracious though so nothing to complain about there.

bloody Mary's were good not too spicy but enough of a little kick. Margaritta on the rocks was underwhelming. They did have a german non alcoholic beer though so it was nice that our non drinker got to participate as well.
author: Meg N.

description: Minus one star for the "every man for himself" seating arrangement. For this money, I want a hostess to seat my party. That said, best fish and chips I've ever had. Amazing. Great beer and wine selection. It's a madhouse on gamedays but worth it.
author: Brian B.

description: We always stop here before a Giants game to pick up our beers and bring them to our seats. Much much cheaper beer here than inside the park. Always crowded. Friendly staff.
author: Meg G.

description:
The service was fantastique! We sat outside during a Giants game. Though we had ordered drinks at the bar, the manager came out once to ask if we needed a refill, and a server came out to check up on us as well. We ended up shooting the breeze with the server for a 5 minutes. 

Oddly, we were charged more for the second round of drinks -because they were served at our table? This was an unfortunate mark, less one star. 

The man at the front of the restaurant told us the kitchen was closed at 8:30, which turned out to not be true. That was a turn-off as well. 

The beer was delicious! A maple something good, and a sweet fuscia cider-esque brew. Both were magically delicious.
author: Em L.

description: Lots and lots of TVs playing different sporting events - when the Giants were winning the Padres, I didn't know where to look first, haha!  A solid menu of nicer-than-ballpark food, drinks and Humphrey Slocombe ice cream, plus attentive service - can't ask for much more!  Plus, there's a side door to directly enter the ballpark - very cool!
author: Maile N.

description:
I only come here before Giants game.

ok drinks. always crowded but i do like the back door into the stadium.
author: Carol Y.

description: Pro tip: When you're at a Giants game, get your beer here during the game--and bring it back to your seat. Better selection. I had a Woodfour sour farmhouse ale and an Almanac Tequila Barrel Noir. Yowza!
author: Maximillian M.

description:
I was sad to hear that Acme has changed into Public House, but i understand the reasoning. What was once a pretty nice place to get a steak has turned into what you would expect to find next to a ballpark. They've got plenty of microbrews, and large TV viewing areas but its gotten a little dingy in style.

Went after the USC v Cal game and the place smelled (BO & Beer) and felt like any other sports bar (Crowded and Loud).

The next day we went back for drinks again and the place had a few people, and felt just dead. The staff looked uninterested and so did the patrons.
author: Johnny C.

description: Decided to stop in here on a non-game day and enjoy the patio. The weather was perfect and the service was impeccable. Our waiter made good recommendations on beers and I was impressed he knew the lineup of draft beers so thoroughly. My only complaint was the quality of the chicken wings- they were very small with little meat on them. I think there might have been 10 in the order- maybe 12; I would have much preferred an order of fewer, more plump wings vs the anemic ones served. I'll order something else next time (maybe I should have sent them back) as I definitely plan to come back again on a non-game day.
author: Juan F.

description: OK, so I had to come here to pay off a World Series bet. We got here early because we read all those reviews about how busy it gets before a Giants game, about 7 hours early so we got seated right away.  Our waiter was super and brought us our drinks (good local beer selection) and really good onion rings and then he disappeared.  We were in no hurry and were able to order drink refills from a semi clueless manager.  When we asked what happened to our waiter he said that he went on break.  The break must have been for dinner for it took about 45 minutes.  When he came back it didn't take long to get our entrees.  My friend had the rib special which was really good and not that expensive.  My fish and chips was less satisfying being really bland with the beer batter adding almost nothing and the tartar sauce so dilled up that it more of a distraction than an addition to the flavor.  About 5 hours before the game the place started to fill up with orange and black garbed fans and the scramble for tables was on. I would come back but maybe for an away game.
author: Victor T.

description:
The fish and chips was below average. Soggy fish.  My wife had a cheese steak sandwich which tasted good but the meat was a little tough.

The onion rings were excellent.

Be aware that this restaurant adds a 4% surcharge to your bill. Some nonsense the city cooked up.  I will not go back here. The food was not worth the price much less an extra 4%.
author: Paul R.

description:
I want to like this place so badly since it is close to home.  Maybe catering to games and tourists makes it hard to have a close warm-like environment.  Never feel welcome- almost the opposite.  Food is definitely sub par. This is
my 2nd try will try 1 more time but that will be it. Come please get people that love their job and cooks proud of their food.
author: Sandy N.

description: Went in today for lunch and found a table on the patio after figuring out, with no help whatsoever, that it's "seat yourself". First table we sat at had balance problems. Maybe throw that one away or repair it, ya think? Second table was better and in a great view spot. 5 minutes. 10 minutes. 15 minutes. No one came. We saw a waitperson on the entire patio once while we were there. He served a couple beers and we heard him say he was "beyond busy". At 20 minutes and no service we left and went to Brenda's.
author: Jim V.

description:
Came here on a Sunday and restaurant was empty ( it was a away game for giants so not busy  ) we ordered the  onion rings to start ... So an  onion ring should at least be crispy and hold it shape ... These rings were more like sautéed onions with very little coating and limp .... Very sad .

Ordered Two Entree's ...  fish and chips and flat iron steak with fries .

Battered fish was good and steak a little dry but edible ... But again the fries were soggy and limp ?? How can a ball park not make descent French fries   ? dude it's fried and not that hard to do .

Four glasses of wine and bill came to $96.97 for really fast bad food .... This is a ok place to grab a beer or meet people before heading to game but not for a good food dining experience .

Service was good ( Thomas )
author: Toby H.

description:
This one's kinda long kids... 

Just happened to be here on a GREAT sports night. The Dodgers and Gigantes were playing right next door, Michigan beat Notre Dame in the first night game in Ann Arbor since the Confederacy was popular, USC squeeking past Utah, and the first Sunday of NFL football was mere hours away. 

The place is, literally, attached to the hip of AT&T Park so it's impossible to miss whether you're wearing your contacts or not. Admittedly, as much as I love sports, I'm not a huge sports bar dude simply because places like to jack up the prices during an event (c'mon, it's a regular season Lakers game and we're paying to park?) or claim themselves a sports bar with about two, 17-inch TVs in the whole joint (there aren't any OSHA regulations on calling yourself a sports bar?) or, quite frankly, think too highly of themselves because the place is crowded so the service is nonexistent (EVERY table is full sweetheart, I don't want to hear about your busy night; I just want some ketchup). 

It was surprisingly not too crowded before the Giants and Dodgers got started and the nigh college football games began. My waitress, Whitney, came to my table nestled comfortably between two flat screens; one with michigan-notre dame and the other with usc and utah, so there wasn't much of a wait there. She recommended a very weak nor cal pale ale but I didn't fault her for this, for after she found out I was actually ordering food, she became a bit more helpful. Now, she took my credit card for a tab and I don't know if that's a game day thing or what but it was a weird to me. I wasn't at the bar...was at an actual table. 

Onward. 

Ordered the Masami Ranch Bibs in Cider Glaze with some sweet potato fries and shortly after, Whitney brings the condiments. They were all aligned in a carrier you might find in Kohl's or somewhere: ketchup, relish, mustard, etc...but I ordered ribs sweetheart, don't think I have much use for all of that. 

Food comes...ok...ribs are a little small as it was an appetizer dish BUT it was also 15 bucks. Make a decision Public House, this ain't Morton's or Ruth's Chris; $15 dollar appetizers are not allowed in an alleged sports bar. I had no silverware and it took Whitney waaaay too long to come see me after the food came considering that 1. the food just arrived so you need to make sure everything is all good there and 2. I had been finished with my ale for at least a few 3 and outs. 

Next up was the Ballast Point Barmy Ale out of San Diego and...they...were...out...of...it. Had to settle for the Bear IPA and it was alright just nothing to write Yelp about so I'll continue... 

I'm not a dessert eater no matter what my stomach circumference says but I had to get it in for my Yelpers sooooo I ordered the Ballpark Brownie. Someone put a picture of this thing on here and that's exactly what it looks like...cracker jacks and all. Again, a novelty dessert but the richness of the brownie and chocolate syrup all over it left a bit to be desired. When it came, I was spoonless and had to ask the lady, who was not Whitney, to bring me one. 

Beer 3 was Lagunitas Lil Sumpin Wild and I figured out I should have had that the previous two times. Whitney was a very nice person but quite obviously green when it came to her trade. The food was alright, the ambiance the same, the prices were over what they should have been and considering San Fran's 4% health tax on anything not leafy green, and despite its proximity to AT&T, even an awesome sports night couldn't make this a destination spot.
author: aaron w.

description: Crazy busy but it's to be expected.. Food is alright. I really liked the Pickle Jar. Service is awesome in the dining room.. TV's everywhere! Fun place but the crowds are too much sometimes.. Way too many drunk people.
author: G. F.

description:
Can't beat the location, and definitely the best big sports bar near the ballpark. Lots of great beer on tap, food is good, and TVs everywhere. 
The 5 stars is more to do with the service- they are pretty attentive for how busy they usually are, but after a buddy had a cracked rim on his drink, we got a personal apology from the manager, and an offer to buy the drink. Very sincere and stand up move, not very common these days.
author: Jean-Paul L.

description:
I couldn't be happier with this place. When craft beer and Giants baseball come together on this scale, it really is awesome. Public House is a perfect place to meet with friends before the game or grab drinks before heading to your seats. The food is pretty good pub fare and beer prices are reasonable.
Perhaps the greatest attraction is being able to get your beer togo for the game!
author: Jeffrey C.

description: Best spot to get yourself fed & watered before a Giants game! Cubano is great tasting, full of flavor. A day game gotta go with their breakfast burrito.
author: Scott B.

description:
I love this place. Amazing rotation of craft beers and a great way to get into Giants games without having to wait in long lines outside AT&T park. Missing out on giveaways is worth taking in a quality craft beer for less than the 1/2 the price of a crappy domestic beer inside the stadium. 

Unfortunately, my stomach of steal succumbed to a bit of food poisoning from a veggie sandwich I had here. I reported the incident to the GM the following day. They were concerned, investigated and addressed the issue. Despite possibly a freak occurrence, I would recommend this place to anyone. Sadly, I will not order the same item again but I will return and order something else. The management and chef is highly dedicated to the quality of food.  

Go GIANTS!!
author: Keren R.

description:
This is a 3.5 star review

Ambiance:  if you love Giants, this is a place where you feel at home. Great service. I like that you sit "community style."  Share tables with others. 

Food:  it's okay. We had sliders and they were good, but nothing to jump up and down about. Beer assortment was good. 

Price:  a little pricey for bar food (even in SF). It's a good deal if you go during Happy Hour. However, this doesn't apply on game days. :/
author: Anh L.

description:
I know it's the "place to be" before a Giant's game, but my first experience yesterday was AWFUL!  I'll start by saying that I GET that they're crazy busy.  The place was packed when I was there @ 1 yesterday.  I didn't want to stay long needing to get in line for the game, so I placed a simple order - a Blue Moon beer and an order of fries with Ranch on the side.

When my beer arrived it was in a small wine glass, not a pint glass like others at my table had been served their beers in. Huh?  And it was NOT a Blue Moon. It was some beer that tasted like clove!  Ick!   Of course by the time I realized this the waitress was long gone.  It was another 10 minutes before I saw her again.  I told her I didn't like the beer I was served and it was *not what I ordered.  She said, "I told you we didn't have Blue Moon and I'd bring you something similar."  Ummm, no, you didn't, and usually if that's the case the waitstaff will ASK you what else you'd like, right?  I told her I needed to go and would just pass on the beer and she reminded me about my order of fries.  I said to just forget the fries and she looked at me as though I was canceling  a cooked to order filet mignon or something.  I said, fine, can I get them to go?  Yes.  What arrived was a small to-go box that was about 1/3 full of GARLIC FRIES.  There were so few fries that I could see the bottom of the box!  Ridiculous.  And I don't like Garlic Fries.  Fail #2!

She gave me my bill that was for $7.33 which included a charge of $.50 for watered down Ranch dressing.  Outrageous, but what was I going to do?  I gave her $10 and she gave me $2 in change... Ummm... where's the rest of my $$??  She said she didn't have coins.  Ok.... In this case shouldn't they err on the side of the customer??  She should have given me $3, right?

I *might have given her a tip if she hadn't stiffed me $1.  I don't like it when people decide what i'm going to do with MY money!

We're talking about a beer and fries.  Probably the easiest thing anyone could order and she couldn't get any of it right and then decided that I didn't need the $.77 that should have been in my change.  If I go again I'll order water and see how that goes.
author: Abby L.

description:
I didn't eat or drink at this place, but definitely want people to know about their extremely rude bartender. 

I went in with my girl before a Giants game to grab a quick drink. Tried ordering a Redbull/Vodka, to which the bartender replies "we don't do that here" as he mumbled some other useless BS. I asked if they had redbull and he rudely says "I don't know how many other ways I can tell you that we don't have redbull". Uhhh, no redbull? I understand you want to promote the tons of beers you have, but what kind of bar doesn't have redbull? 

If I had time I would've stayed and gave the a$$hole a piece of my mind, but instead we left and went across the street to Pedro's (which was awesome). Honestly, screw convenience, I will not be back to deal with that pretentious attitude.
author: Shaun J.

description: This food is sooo good! Fans of the Giants dine her sine it's underneath AT&T Park. I can't speak enough about the food, it is amazing!! The bf and I could not believe we haven't dined here out of all the nights we've been coming here! Great food and service and perfect for anything around a Giants game!
author: Marie P.

description:
Do you remember where you were when David Aikers missed 13 field goals in one season? 

This is still a great bar for beer and to watch sports though - can't wait for Baseball!
author: Braden D.

description:
Okaaay, I cannot tell a lie. I only came here to use their nice and clean bathroom after drinks somewhere else. They welcomed me to do so. 

*Very friendly staff! 

Extensive menu of drinks and I spotted Humphry Slocombe ice cream (http://www.yelp.com/biz/humphry-slocombe-ice-cream-san-francisco). This bathroom trip has now turned into a dessert trip. 

*Secret Breakfast and Tahitian Vanilla craving- fulfilled. 

I tried Acme Chophouse when it was here once. But I think I liked it. I heard Public House is affiliated- something to look into. I'll be baaack! 

P.S. GOOOO GIANTS! =)
author: S Y.

description: $19 for hamburger and fries is ridiculous. The service is terrible. Only come here if you're looking for a convenient place to eat before a game.
author: Diana V.

description: So expensive...$7 for a pint of beer. Sure, it's under AT&T, but $7? Eesh. This place is barely ever packed too because everyone just pre-games here and then heads off into the ballpark. You can be here in the 3rd inning of a home game and just be sitting pretty much next to the only 3 other people inside. It really goes dead around 9/10pm, even on game days. The food isn't bad here, and the service is pretty solid. Prices for the food are actually almost the same as the drinks. Who would have figured? They serve their nachos on a giant tortilla to help you scoop up the melted cheese, and they have ballast point on tap. I haven't seen that in a while.
author: Danny C.

description:
This is probably the best place to drink prior to a Giants game! Why, you might ask? Two reasons:
1. It's the closest bar to the park (it's basically attached).
2. You can bring in beers from here into AT&T park!

The beers are about $6-$7 a piece. They put the beers in plastic cups for you so if you like to have a beer whilst enjoying the baseball game, I'd buy an extra cup from here before going in. It's cheaper than buying the $10.25 beers inside AT&T park! Last time, I believe they didn't mind me having two beers in my hand to go into the park. You can get your tickets checked from an entrance within the restaurant/bar too! 

The convenience of the place wins all the brownie points!
author: Connie Y.

description: Food is great . But service is questionable . 1 time at establishment and servers seem like they are doung you a favor to serve you. Next time its momos for me
author: Sam S.

description:
In theory, this place can't be beat. SOOO many taps, a full bar, and a creative menu. Entry into the ballpark through a different door, and you can bring in your $7 craft beer, instead of paying for an $11 domestic can.

I would love to love this place. I WANT to love this place. But.... after a few burns, I have to accept it as a three-star place, and accept what to expect.

Beers on tap: 5 stars. With so many taps, and many of them rotating, it's really easy to find a beer that everyone will love. There are a couple of hand-pumps too... if you're into that kind of thing.

Food: 4 stars. It's a creative menu, but it's still very familiar. Their brunch items look promising. But their bar bites... delish! 

Service: With the exception of one bartender (who usually tends on the beer-only side), 1 star. The one exception gets 5 stars, (and forgive me, because I don't know his name), because he's fast, he's fair, he doesn't give you attitude, and he's more than willing to walk to the other bar for you to grab the beer that you requested. He's fantastic. Everyone else can go to you-know-where. Servers here SUCK. So do the other bartenders. However... the barbacks and the bussers are very polite and apologize for their servers being jerks.

No doubt that I'll be back.... but you can bet that I'll be draggin ass.
author: Mar A.

description:
I just want to say.  That I would go back here.  Not during the NLCS.

Because the tap list is awesome and local.  And even when packed shoulder to shoulder with Giants fans waiting to get into the game, they answered my companion's beer questions and served her an awesome sour.

Getting a beer and taking it into the secret back stadium entrance took an awful long time on a crowded game day and was not faster than going in the main gate.  But it seems like the only way to get decent craft brew at a decent price in the stadium.
author: Albert H.

description: We went to Public House for Opening Day 4/13/2015 for lunch and Giants game watching.  It was GREAT!  There were two of us posted up at one of the bar tables.  Figured it would be too much of a zoo, but we got a table and had a great time.  We shared the Vegetarian Nacho appetizer, the Romaine/Jicama/Radish/Cucumber/Cotija Cheese/Lime Vinaigrette salad and the Public House Burger.  The service was FANTASTIC, the food was fresh, the game viewing was phenomenal and surprisingly we were able to watch the game and converse and eat at the same time.  It was the closest thing to having a seat in the ballpark without having a seat at the ballpark.  I would go back again anytime.
author: Maura S.

description:
Simply the BEST pre-game option for GIGANTES games! 
Food options are consistently on par. The appetizers are the way to go before games. Pretzels, roasted cauliflower and sliders are great options. Somewhat pricey on the food but everything in the area is.

Micro-brew options are why I got up the Public House before EVERY game. GREAT/FANTASTIC-O selection of brews that are cycled through each month. Russian River Blind Pig, Ballast Point and other local Cali Brews on tap.
NOTE: Double fist them brews before entering AT&T from the Public House!!!! Trust me it's much advised!

Enjoy this 2014 season!!! Go GIANTS!!!!
author: Shane F.

description:
Seriously San Francisco baseball fans... if you don't appreciate Public House, you don't know what you've got!

I'm not sure that I'd be rushing here if I weren't going to a game... but as a pre-game spot, it can't be beat.  And I am SO jealous that your pre-game spot can be your mid-game spot with access in and out of the ballpark being allowed.  Best idea ever!  

It was super crowded before the game, but we clickly learned that basic manners took us far with  the bartenders.  The beer selection was vast and the lite bites we shared hit the spot.  Truly enjoyed.
author: Valerie G.

description: One if my favorite places to watch the SF Giant's games. Good fun vibe every time my husband and I go. It's the closest I can get to the stadium and to all the action going on at Willie Mays Plaza. Love this place!
author: Cindy S.

description:
In the past, it really bummed me out that beers at the Giant's games were such a rip-off. Well, Public House stopped my bumming! I'd read on Yelp (thanks Andrew!) that you could get beers here and bring them into the game and that we did!

My friend ordered a very strong beer for almost $10 and we picked out four more cups of different beers. It was a nice little shmorgageboard of beer deliciousness :) I think the Affligen was my favorite but even better than this particular beer was the $25 total with tip for 4 beers that lasted us through the rest of the game. HOME RUN!!!
author: Meghan P.

description:
Wow, I'm shocked. I disappear from Yelp for a few months, and reviews go to the dogs. Like some of the stuff written about Public House. People seem to be shocked at slow service when they're there on a game day, when the place is absolutely slammed - those same folks seem to have absolutely no issue with slow service, or having to wait for a table when they're at Burma Superstar or something. But no, a place that serves fish and chips should be able to magically produce it from the thin air, on demand.

Hmm.

Anyways, I digress. 

I've been to the Public House... about a dozen times at this point. Usually before/after (and during) a game, since I'd rather enjoy reasonably priced, quality food as opposed to a gut busting hotdog and cold garlic fries. It's always packed, but it's worth the hassle. At the VERY least, their beer selection is outstanding. Two dozen beers - with two more on cask - and most of them outstanding selections with offerings from the likes of Stone, Avery, Ommegang, Allagash, Dogfish Head and more. Plus all your local faves from Anchor, Moylans, Bear Republic, and Marin Brewing. All sold at what you'd expect to pay at a regular bar, not ballpark prices. And there's the treat - head down between innings, and make your choice. A $6 Racer 5 (a full pint, too, as opposed to the 10oz pours in the stadium) or a $9 Bud Light. Hmm, let me think.

Food at Public House is to be expected. Lots of sports bar type fare, a lot of which is designed to be "to go", for you to cart to your seat. Their gameday food to go is the only blot on Public House's copybook - I've had fish and chips to go, and when I got back to my seat found them to be somewhat bland, cold, and not very good. However, when I've had fish and chips at the restaurant, it's been outstanding. Gorgeous double fried chips, seasoned with sea salt and rosemary, and the fish was perfect. Don't get me started on their ribeye steak frites, their Saturday night special that had me almost licking my plate afterwards.

So there you are. Public House is a solid four star joint - five if they improved gameday food - as long as you go in there taking it for what it is. Which is an outstanding place to grab a beer, and a pretty decent spot for dinner when the Giants are on the road.
author: Gary E.

description:
Someone else posted:

"So bummed.  Came and waited in line before the game, but by the time they opened all the tables were taken bc ppl had snuck through Mijita.  So irritated we waited in line for this.  Even tried to make reservations but was told they don't take any...several tables reserved.  They should have a better way to manage this!"


I unfortunately did not read posting on this site before waiting in line @ 2.30 for the place to open.  Me and my buddy were perhaps the 15/16 in line, eagerly anticipating getting a nice spot at the bar or even a little table....
Well that did not happen!

 The mob that got in through mijita, didn't even have their bags checked, where as everyone going through the front door did. I want to place a conservative estimate that 50-70 ppl got in, through Mijita, by the time we did!!!  

By the time we got inside the only place to find a seat was outside in the patio area where you can get a glimpse of their 20 inch aquos tvs that are posted inside!

There aren't any TV's that are truly viewable and enjoyable from the outside and NO audio at all!.... this was Game 6 2014 world series.

Needless to say - all of this left a very bad taste.....and there was NO WAY to enjoy the game there so after the first inning, took a taxi into downtown and watched at a restaurant that was managed WAY better.

Sad to say - I will not be revisiting the public house, I'd rather go to Lucky Strike/Pete's Tavern/any other bar rest in the area.

Short of it is - it's a great location but it is HORRIBLY MANAGED!!

The only reason I gave them 1 star - is for the Giants!
author: JIMMY P.

description:
During the Giants season and the NBA playoffs this is the place to be. I never been for a Niners game but I hope the same thing goes on during Niners games. Nothing more fun than high-fiving multiple inebriated sports fans whenever the home team makes a big play. It is also equally fun to scream out multiple profanities at the TV with multiple sports fans whenever a call goes against your home team (even if the call was correct, do you really wanna be that guy who is rational and agrees with the referees?)

During the off-season it is pretty dead though. I came here during the off-season to watch the Dodgers lose in the playoffs and nobody was there. It is a pretty big bar though, plenty of space, TVs, and it's just really nicely designed inside. It looks classy is what I wanna say I guess.
author: Wells Y.

description: I love coming here before a Giants game especially because you can bring your beer inside the park from here. Make sure you let the bartender know you want to bring your beer inside the park so that they can put it in a plastic cup inside of the glass ones. Beer here is cheaper and there is more selection! We had the Russian River IPA and much to my delight, it was really flavorful and good. Come here earlier, it gets crowded before a game. And on game where the Giants are away, they have happy hour from 3-6pm.
author: Loree T.

description: I can watch Warriors playoffs AND Giants?  People are cheering for both teams, both screens?  This is the place to be.  Everyone has a good attitude here and the bartenders are great.  They are patient.  Love the winning atmosphere here.  Most of the patrons are not obnoxious and nice.
author: Chris L.

description: Solid option to see a game or post up pre or post game Good bar food (wings/nachos) and a great beer selection.
author: Jeff F.

description: We came in well after the Monday Night Football crowds had left and basically had most of the bar to ourselves. Doing some late eats we got the short rib potato skins, philly cheesesteak, burger, and chicken pot pie. Everything was pretty solid. I like the fact that they source a bunch of local vendors like 4505 meats and such. The manager and bartender/server were super nice. Usually when you walk into a place 10 min before closing, they discourage you but they welcomed us with open arms. They're trying to get more locals to come on non game nights. Im sure during game nights it's a mad house, so it's worth checking out when it's chill
author: Kim N.

description: Such a cool place, I was stoked out about the feature of the building and how there is an entrance to AT&T Park. Our server, Paul, was a great and friendly guy. Had our Bar Bites squeezed in a little after Happy Hour and our food and beverages were pretty good. We came here to watch the Giants/Rangers and Paul came in in the loop and discussed about little actions in the game! Looking forward to come back again!
author: Jasmine B.

description:
I'm bumping Public House down a notch for only one reason.  I'll get to that later...

Otherwise, the concept works from seating your own party and choosing from all the different draft beers available.  The food selection is somewhat limited with some of the selection coming from Mijita, Public House's sister restaurant.  The chicken nachos I got were $12 and my friends' fish and chips were $15.  It's too bad I couldn't get something like a mini pizza or meatloaf.  That would've been great!

So my disappointment was that I had arrived there and wanted to try a particular cask barrel beer that they usually carry.  Unfortunately, they ran out before I ever had a chance.  It was traumatic but I managed to grit through it!

The TV screens strewn all around the place made me feel very comfortable, like a Vegas sportsbook.  TV after TV after TV placed right next to each other..now that is a artistic work of beauty!
author: Ben H L.

description: Didn't eat here, but it's a good place to relax and have a few beers before a Giants game. The service was attentive, but the restaurant is quite small and gets really busy before first pitch. I would recommend getting here early if you want your own table.
author: Aman D.

description:
Public House is a great place to go to if you have a ticket to the Giants game, and don't want to pay $10+ for a drink inside AT&T Park. Grab your ticket, go to Public House, get a drink after checking into AT&T, and enjoy the game. They let you bring drinks from Public House into AT&T Park- that's the beauty of this whole thing. 

When the Giants were in the playoffs this year, I went with my friend here to watch the game on t.v. It was hard to find seating at first, and the bar was packed, but we eventually snagged a small table. We had some tea with dinner which hit the spot. I will say, though, the prices for the food here are ridiculous. We split an appetizer so we wouldn't have to drop $20-30 bucks. We split the mac and cheese which were 2 to 3 bite sized squares. They were great, but left us hungry.
author: Linnea H.

description:
Went here after a Sunday day game. Service was slow, yes it was busy but not crazy packed like I would have thought. 
We ordered a beer, nachos and potato skins. 
Let me start with the potato skins; I'm a HUGE potato lover. These were horrible. $14 for two almost whole potatoes. (Thought these were supposed to be skins?) They were supposed to be topped with pork belly. I think I counted 3 pieces on each potato. The other toppings tasted like straight vinegar. Ick. Not to mention there was only 2. Two?!  Seriously. 
The nachos were decent at best. The chips were great. But the chips shouldn't be the best part of the nachos. They were rather small and were $15 with chicken I think. 
We asked for water when we ordered our drinks and food. Items came with no water. We had to ask a random worker for waters because our server was mia. They came back with 1 water. Weird because there is two of us. Thanks we'll share I guess. 

Unfortunately we won't be back. Too bad because it's convenient after or before a game. Guess we'll try the places across the street next time.
author: Stashley W.

description:
Public House is the place to go before a San Francisco Giants game!  It's the pre game ritual!  Public House has great food, mixed drinks, beer, service, and the vibe is great!  

Lots of tv's so that you can watch all the games and also a nice outdoor eating area where many times KNBR is broadcasting the pre game show live right in front of the tables.  It's fun to eat a pre game snack and watch the action on Willie Mays Plaza.  

Also, Public House is connected directly to AT&T Park so it makes it very convenient to enter the game and hopefully watch the Giants win!!!
author: Devon B.

description:
Ever wonder what it must be like to have a severe case of ADHD?  All you have to do is go into the back room at Public House and sit yourself in front of 10 flat panel TVs.  I went here with friends early Sunday morning to partake in the American awesomeness that is NFL Sunday.  All the TVs were tuned to different games and at any given moment there was a different play happening.  My head was in sensory overload.    
The physical space is really really nice.  The food and drinks are expensive (6 bucks for Budd Light on draft?!) but that's a  given when you go to a place built into a ball park.  Is it strange that I'm most excited at the prospect of watching hockey games here?  Hopefully after baseball season dies down people forget about this place and they will have the hockey package.
author: Darin E.

description:
The food was good but nothing I'd die to have again.  Drink prices were decent--better than inside the park that's for sure!
Really, it's just a nice alternative place to park your butt when you want to be in on the game action but don't have a ticket.  I'd never go out of my way to come here other than for that purpose.

The Mac n cheese appetizer was quite interesting though.  Worth a try...
author: Britt B.

description:
I wish back home we had those kind of Sports-Bars. Great place, great city, awesome Sports-Nation!

Due to the end of the Giants season there's not much going on right now, so it's pretty quiet. But you can feel the spirit of Sports all around.

Will hopefully be back one day when the Giants are playing again.

Big Plus: Free WiFi, thanks to AT&T...
author: Oliver M.

description: I go to several giants games each season and had never tried this place.  It's really good!  I had a chicken avocado Bacon sandwich.... so yummy!  The service was fairly good, the waiter even told me I was gorgeous (fishing for tips? Lol)  he was great and attentive,  but then disappeared.... another waiter was all of a sudden in his place.  Nothing said about it though.  Other than that, great food and gotta love watching the game on the big screens!
author: Laurie L.

description: Headed there with a group of 12 people before a Cirque event.  They were awesome to reserve some tables for me in a sort of private area.  Just after we were seated the manager asked if we would move over to a bigger table because they wanted to use the private area for a much larger group.  Not a problem we are easy.  What impressed me so much was the manager called me the next day to apologize for not seeing us before we left and he wanted to personally thank me.  Honestly, this might be a problem with other people be it was no big deal for us. It's just a table. Super Impressed by the manager and If we ever need to hold an event for a large group I will be calling him up.
author: Eddie E.

description:
This review gets 5 stars because of two people: Nathan and Stephanie. BOTH deserve a raise! 

I went here with a few friends for a Giants game the other day and, being gluten-free, I have to be very careful about my diet. Stephanie was more than helpful, making sure that I didn't order something that would hurt me. She knew the menu and the options I had without even missing a beat. 

Her shift ended and we were passed to another server who didn't know the menu as well and allowed us to order something that would have really hurt me. Stephanie caught it when she saw the order go up and Nathan took time out of his very busy day to talk with me and he made the situation right. 

Stephanie kept me from a trip to the hospital and Nathan made me more than happy with my experience. Both are amazing and I will definitely be back to Public House soon.
author: Renee P.

description: Love stopping here before giants games! Always crowded with giants fans everywhere. It's nice to stop in and grab a drink before heading inside. Bartenders are always super quick and friendly!
author: Marina D.

description:
This place has singlehandedly revolutionized any trip to the ballpark for me.  Not only can you have an awesome selection of beers at hand, but the private entracnce the the ballpark is a great bonus.  

There is no point in getting a $10 beer inside when you can have a great pint inside from their wide variety of beers and simply bring it into the game in comfort.
author: Joey S.

description:
Beautiful sports bar and wonderful service, but that's about it. 

I've wanted to try this place for quite some time now. My friend and I arrived an hour early before the game and decided to give this place a chance. $27 later on my own meal, it was enough to make up my mind not to go for food the next time I visit AT&T park. 

$12 bratwurst from the company called 4505. It was bland, but the plus was the crispy toasted bun. 
$5 Kracker Jax. Was this on the 7x7? Just one chunk of this snack makes me want to run to my dentist. Overdone on caramel. The sugar chunks were huge!!
$6 beer. Worth it. Probably the only thing worth going for since beer within the park raised to $9.25. And you can bring any beer to-go in a plastic cup through an entrance from the restaurant. 

Come early, especially days with games. Any later than 530 (or maybe 430)? You won't get a table. We were lucky enough to find a tiny table to share with some strangers.
author: Rosanne L.

description:
I am writing this from an event planner perspective. 
I work at an office that has group happy hours quite often. I wanted to try something new so I thought Public House would be great.

This place was great from the beginning stages of planning till walking out the door the day of our event. Nathan was great with planning and made a lot of accommodations for us. The other on duty manager Tiffany and our server (forgot her name!) and bussers were amazing as well. Food was great, appetizers were great.

I was really impressed and hope to host a happy hour there again. :D
author: Stacy S.

description:
Awesome location, nice establishment.  That's the two stars.

Food is crap, you don't even need cooks to make anything they serve.  It's all fried and reheated.

Beer selection is decent.

And lastly, my favorite...service.  Our bartender had the worst attitude ever.  We did not appreciate her and her lack of personality, aka people skills.  You'd think someone in the service industry would make the most of their shift to earn extra money.  I still left her 18% (having been a server/bartender during college) although her human interaction skills were as warm as a ship sinking iceberg.

I'd recommend a walk across the street to Pete's instead.
author: Alex T.

description:
Great people, great food, great environment! 

Went there for the Sunday's game 5. I have to say it was the closest thing I can get without being inside the field. Waited in line for about 30 minutes to go in. After I was in though, great experience. 

People were really friend. The waitress were great. Served us cheeseburger even with lots of people they are serving. Service was exceptional for the amount of people they have to serve. 

Wish the restaurant is bigger so they can have a higher capacity of people without waiting in line. Will definite go back next season!

Go Giants!
author: Demetri S.

description:
FOOD:
mac n chz = I love their mac n chz here. It's slightly spinkled on top with bread crumbs? so it has that nice contrasting crunch? mmm....


SERVICE:
good

ATMOSPHERE:
Patio seating, but inside is spacious, modern casual, good place to watch the game since it's like literally under/connected to the ballpark.
author: Angela L.

description:
This place is probably better known for its drinks.

I came here to have dinner and had the following:

Bratwurst sliders, buffalo wings, and onion rings.

These were amongst the absolute worst sliders, buffalo wings, and onion rings I've ever had. The food here is absolutely terrible.

Looking around all I saw were people drinking. So as a bar it's probably fine, but if you want to eat go elsewhere.
author: Joseph K.

description: Appetizers are delicious here! Gets pretty busy but the service is good.
author: Jennifer C.

description: Fun spot to listen to the ATT crowd (if you don't have tix) or watch any other sports. Always take Caltrain here. Parking is impossible or $15-$50. Pricey drinks and decent food, but you pay for the ambience and scenery + crowds. It's fun during Giants season and not worth it during non season.
author: Chuck N.

description:
Food is good. Service was fair. It was a game day and the employees seemed like they did not want to be at work. 

I am rating this a two because they reuse the ketchup in an open container that cannot be sanitized or cleaned. We expressed our concern to management and in the hour we were sitting there nothing was done to clean or make new ketchup containers.  Needless to say a bit disappointed.
author: Jenn C.

description: Love this place awesome atmosphere awesome management great service. What more could you want?
author: Shaina R.

description:
I ate here for the first time on Friday when the Giants played the Twins (GO GIANTS!!) We arrive at 4:30 and they just opened at 4'oclock for HH.  It was self seating and we quickly snagged a table in the corner.
We got water right away and started scanning the small menu.  I had read some Yelp reviews and some of the appetizers didn't sound that great so we opt out of ordering any.  I noticed a Chicken Pot Pie ($15) that sounded yummy and decided on that.  My cutie pie ordered the Philly Cheese Steak Sandwich which he regretted especially after seeing my dish.  My Chicken Pot Pie came in a skillet with a flaky crust (delish!!) with lots of carrots, potatoes and chicken (not to mention goes great with hot sauce).  It was pretty huge that I was able to share with my cutie pie and think he was pretty great full for that. LOL
I had a Blushing Giant cocktail which was also delish! They have great selections of beers that my cutie pie was able to choose from.  (FYI-some of their beers range from $7 + and you are able to buy your beer and bring it to the game because it's attached to the stadium not to mention cheaper!)
Overall, a great experience.  By the time we were leaving, the place was poppin' and it was time to go to our seats nice and stuffed so we didn't have to pay for overpriced soggy food...
author: Lindsey J.

description: Didn't even get service.  Sat at the bar got our IDS checked and no one else was there but bartender didn't even ask us what we wanted to drink.  Not one smile.  Walked out after couple minutes of waiting.  Disappointing.
author: Ivan Jose R.

description:
Honestly, for as busy as it was RIGHT before the giants game against the dodgers (boo) on a Friday night, the service was great. Open seating makes it a little hectic but our server was on top of everything - checked with us the perfect amount of times and despite the craziness we got our order in quickly and got our food piping hot also. 

Anyone who complains about the prices clearly doesn't know how much you end up spending on food INSIDE the park.
author: Alexandra M.

description:
I came here alone on a Saturday afternoon to grab a bite before a Cal football game and to wait for some friends, and luckily found a table.

Waited for 15 minutes for a server to come over, no server ever came. I approached a sever at the server station and asked if there was a server, named Jennifer, helping the area I was seated and her response was, "Ya that's me, what do you want?".... O.o. So I told her my order. She brought me the beer I had ordered, I asked for a glass and she brings over a warm glass for my cold beer. Yay! 

My pork pulled sliders and side of Brussels sprouts arrived but I had no utensils, napkins, small plate or condiments. So I asked the server that brought my food for some utensils and a plate. He condescendingly asked me, "Utensils and a plate? WELL how many do you want?". I looked around my table and said "One", "One?" he asked me, again, I looked around my table, puzzled, and said "Ya, One". 

I kept having to ask for everything from the bussers. 

I sat there for an hour, never approached by a server and never asked how everything was and I was never given the check, even THAT I had to hunt down my server to ask for...they may not want to serve me but you would think that they would want my money!? 

Mind you, I work in the service industry so this type of service is completely unacceptable to me. I don't care how busy your establishment is, it takes no effort to be courteous. I mean YOU ARE IN THE SERVICE INDUSTRY!! I also find it shocking that not once did my server thank me and not once did anyone ever say "you're welcome" when I thanked them. 


Lunch: $24.75
Tip: $0.25
Total: $25.00

I WILL NEVER GO BACK HERE AGAIN!
author: Danna N.

description:
Honestly if this wasn't attached to the ball park I'd never go. It's very overpriced, but you can bring your drinks into the park. 

TIP: Be careful when you're ordering, they have a list of beers but they aren't all the same size. My friends ordered a drink and it came in a shot sized glass even though it was listed on the same list as all the others. Make sure you're paying attention!
author: Lauren D.

description:
Sitting on the outside patio with our dog on a non-game day. EXCELLENT!!! The server, Paul, was an excellent server. Very nice, courteous, everything you would ask for in great service. 
The chilaquiles are AMAZING!!! YUM!!
New fave place!
author: Mina B.

description: For a sports bar, pretty great. two large bars, really good food. But yes, mediocre service. Good luck tracking down a bartender/waiter...
author: Alice Z.

description:
Public House is a solid place to get a beer and some pub grub. I was there early on a Friday evening when the Giants were not in town and the place was pretty empty. I had no problem getting a seat at the bar and the beer list was pretty good. It was not stuffed with your run of the mill beers, but they had some of those for the less adventurous. 
The prices are reasonable but the service was a little slow. One thing I liked was the beer master was providing sample tastes to the bartenders and serving staff so they can be educated on what the beers taste like when someone asks for a recommendation. Good job. 
Will I be back? Sure I will.
author: Bill C.

description:
Came here this past Sunday to catch the Niners/Seahawks game (Boooo!) and for a coworker's going away dinner. I've been in the area so many times, but never had a chance to come here.

On a rainy Sunday Niners game night, the restaurant was not crowded at all. It is a very spacious place, with numerous screens in every direction you look, showing mostly the game (and other high-profile sports-related viewings). Talking and catching up with friends was fairly easy because we didn't have to shout with each other.

Sadly, I didn't think the food was all that great. Our large group shared the buffalo chicken wings, sweet potato fries and nachos. They tasted like stuff I could get at much cheaper places. A friend and I also ordered the Cubano sandwich, and I actually regretted us getting it. The chips tasted funky/stale and the sandwich didn't have as much flavor as I was expecting.

The beers that they have are good. Maybe I'll change my mind about this place when I come back for a second time, hopefully before a Giants game.
author: Melissa D.

description: Just had lunch here yesterday. It was a non-game day so very quiet. I sat at the bar & enjoyed a cold beer from their nice beer selection. The bartender was my waiter as well & he was super efficient. I had the only burger on the menu & it was cooked a perfect medium rare & so juicy! I ate the whole thing! Short menu but those around me said the Cubano sandwich & soup of the day were delicious as well. Tip...if you park on 3rd in baseball lots it's $15 all day or can pay by hour...cheaper than lots down town. You have to walk like two blocks but get to walk over cool drawbridge & view is amazing.
author: Robin O.

description: On off game nights, if it's open, a solid pre 10p spot to grab an affordable drink and bite.
author: Uncle Fishbits Aeneas X.

description:
What a great place to watch the Giants Game!!! I managed to get in for the FINAL WORLD SERIES game as month and it was awesome watching it with hundreds of fellow fans!   My friend and I got in right before they cut off the capacity for the day - it was PACKED inside but it was so fun watching it with everyone.  It was super hot inside because of all the warm bodies so we managed to get a little table in the outside patio and drink some beer and share some sweet potato fries!  All the people that weren't able to get in were STANDING watching the game for 3+ hours thru the window! Dedication! 

And of course they won, so we were got first pickings for World Series items and got to see everyone get crazy and climb the light posts and dance in the middle of the intersection in front of AT&T park! :)

So much fun and of course GO GIANTS!!!  Hope it goes the same for 2013!
author: Angela K.

description:
I love the roasted cauliflower here, so tasty. I always like to order multiples because everyone likes it. The soft pretzel bites are good too. The butterscotch pudding is creamy and delicious.
The nachos were ok, nothing special. Friendly bartenders, outdoor seating when it's open.
author: Jenny W.

description:
Did you know it's attached to the park?

For reals.  They have an entrance IN the bar.  The food was pretty good for pub food and they have a pretty gall derned amazing list of local craft beers.  The only drawback I found was no happy hour on game days, even night games...BOO!
author: Eric L.

description: This is a bar/restaurant that is connected to AT&T Park.  We didn't try any food, but had a few beers prior to going into the park.  Pros... 1)You can get straight into the park from inside the bar, 2) The beers are significantly cheaper in the bar rather than the park.  Cons... The bouncers are rude and pushy.  It seemed that no matter where we stood, it was standing room only, I was told that I wasn't allowed to stand there.  Tip for the day...be sure to grab a beer to bring into the game and save yourself a couple bucks.
author: Jimmy M.

description:
Come guys...don't come here at half time during football Sunday and expect to find a table. Get here early, hang your coat up and sit in front of the HUGE flat screens. 

Now that i think about it, it was hard to get the server interested in our table, but Nathan, is a cool dude. He is friendly and if he is serving your table then your good to go! 

I always bring my friends and family here for 5 star food and a true FULL bar. Anything you could want, they have it. 

At one point, I sat with my friends at this bar for over 4.5 hours on College football Saturday. Started with irish coffee, then go straight for Racer 5 on tap, wings (fresh not frozen), more Racer 5, shot of Jameson, split the burger its huge, more Racer 5. We may have spent a little more than we wanted put the QUALITY was sensational! 

Save up...and Drink up! Viva la Public House!

BTW: Everywhere charges $20 a pitcher for Racer 5, example: Giordano Bros.
author: Jessica V.

description:
Weakest Bloody Mary ever experienced. The bathroom smelled like a straight up deuce too. Ugh...

Not gonna lie though, I would drop a quad here before a game if it came down to it. Def wouldn't drop one in the stadium.
author: Michael L.

description:
Skip it. Public house is a public  hot mess.

Went there on Saturday night after the game- actually not after, probably was around the 7th inning  after we went to the giants dugout
 Intention was to go back to our club level seats but realized we were getting our asses served to us by Arizona so the public house's side entrance from the ballpark lured us in. We grabbed a table in seconds yet didn't see a server for 10 minutes. Well I saw them in the corner sharing pictures on there iphones and heard them in acronym type conversations but did not see one at our table.

 I was feeling dessert since I usually don't. I ordered something which the server had no idea it was even on the menu as she was only there for a week. I get it -she can't possibly try the whole menu in a week ... but a decent restaurant would not put a server on the floor who is that clueless not to at least fake it right if you can't make it right. She said, " so like when you try it, like let me know, like haha.' Barf. 
You don't really think she care how my butterscotch pudding tasted. Of course not, which is fine because I didn't really want to hear the word  'like' again.
This place clearly hires kids that's barely belong at red robin. No scratch that-  maybe more like a self serve frozen yogurt joint where all they have to do is collect money at the register because I'll tell you this- they're all visibly extremely lazy... much like most born post '87. Just sayin.

My friend ordered sweet potato fries, mini corn dogs & an ice cream sandwich.. all came at the exact same time, imagine that. The fries were like you would taste anywhere else. But the mini corn dogs - the nastiest batter and the grossest dry bite of overfried mess I think I ever tried. Negative 2 stars

 The 1 good thing I could say is that at least they use slocombe ice cream (which is a disservice actually to Humphrey)

 The acne face teenager literally dropped our food down and ran away appropriate title* food runner. When the server came over between giggles to ask how our stuff was, I mentioned we thought it was rude how he literally put the food all balancing on the corner of the table, she was very really immature how she handled it.  "Oh like, he's like always like that." Lame. It felt like I was in a high school cafeteria.

 Prepare to see salads that cost more than entrees. Places like that offend my intelligence. 
 Menu was really unimpressive though I'd hope they do a good burger & basic shit like that for people who are drinking too much & don't know the difference. I'm sure the beers and drinks obviously would be cheaper than the ballpark that's not saying much... there's a dozen bars within a block.

 Note to the owner and management : maybe your bartenders are great but your servers are hurting. Don't hold your breath on being supported by neither the neighborhood because they know better nor from Giants fans who know there's a plethora of options as well.
 Basic business 101* Single visit users don't always hold your doors open. unless you're the only joint in an airport which you are not, chumps.

Remember what happened happened to Acme?
author: Athena S.

description: Favorite place to grab a pre game beer when i go to giants games. They have a amazing selection of beers as well as a full bar.
author: Joe A.

description: We went on a game day, so this might change on a normal day.  The food was ok, I liked the mac and cheese nuggets, but honestly, you could skip it and get better food in the ballpark.  Love the atmosphere, though.  Great for drinking.  You also get a private entrance to the ball park and to take cheaper drinks into the game... love this.  Good drink selection.  So packed on game days... but a good place to be.
author: Lyndsey C.

description:
good selection of beers.  great service.  got real crowded close to game time on a sunday afternoon.  didn't remember much about the food...i think wings but weren't spicy and a reuben?  nothing was wow but did remember the guy next to me said he waited since 7:30am for a brian wilson bobblehead and that we needed to get it.  i said yeah the line is way too long.  guess what buddy, we still got 4 bobbleheads after lunch.

sorry i meant brian wilson gnomes few weeks ago...
author: Kevin L.

description:
Terrible service and a waitress with a very bad attitude. The food is fine, the beer selection is quite good, but the staff was disappointing. Unhappy with her tip, our waitress (Jennifer) aggressively questioned us and was borderline insulting. If you have tickets on a game day, you're better off eating inside the park.

UPDATE: increasing my rating from 1 to 3 stars because of the way the management handled my complaint. I had a good time at the Public House before and hope to again in the future.
author: Victoria S.

description:
Came here before a Giant's game with some coworkers after we had stuffed our faces with Mijita-amazingness. The places was CROWDED. Super crowded. However, by being overly nice to the bouncer we were able to score a little bit of space near the bar to order drinks until a table opened up.

The beer list is good. I'd come here on a non-game day.
author: Melissa N.

description:
I've been going here for the past two years and have finally sat down to give this place the credit it deserves.  

  This is by far one of my favorite bars to come to before any Giants game, or even when they're away for that matter. First off, the beer selection is spectacular. They've had Pliny the Younger, Loads of Dogfish Head's brews, Stillwater, Greenflash, Lagunitas, Stone, Speakeasy, Lost Abbey, Ballast Point, Moylan's and more great beer than I can remember.  And remembering them all can be hard when I'm trying to sample everything they have to offer.

  Now lets get down to the food. It's awesome!  This place had one of the best burgers I've ever eaten. You know that dream burger you always remember for years and even dream about some nights (I don't know about you guys, but if you don't dream about a good burger, then we may be starting off our relationship on the wrong foot) It's a fat burger, stacked with cheese, bacon, avocado (Thank you!!!), and all the usual fixins.  The cheese steak sandwich is a thing of beauty. It's everything you want a cheese steak to be; gooey, smokey, meaty and delicious. The Mac & Cheese? It was described to me as a bubbly cauldron of cheesy goodness and that is exactly what it was. I've even been so bold as to ask for them to even put bacon in it,  WOW is all I'm going to say.  

  Now time to cover the service. I've had great service every time I've been here. Lets get down to it, the place gets packed before games, and it can be a challenge sometimes getting a table, but the management and staff have always been friendly and have helped to get me a seat. They are happy to explain what new beers they have on draft and even let me sample a few so I pick the perfect one, or if I've ever had questions on the menu they will gladly answer any questions I might have.

  You've got to understand this is a ballpark and there are thousands of people who come through the place on game days. It's going to be busy, it's going to be crowded, but if you like being in the middle of the action and getting right into the stadium from the restaurant, with a great craft beer in your hand, then this is the place to go. 

  All in all, I love this place. They can get super busy, but it's a great environment, and the perfect place to be before, or after a Giants game, and any other off night, when I want a cold beer and some killer food.
author: Nathan C.

description: Was pleasantly surprised with the food we ordered.  Started with the crispy cauliflower with raisins and capers.  Sounded strange but was sooo delicious. High recommend.
