description:
What a great pub! We loved the pork and lamb sliders, the stuffed potato skins (different from any I've had), hand made corn dogs, crab cakes, and the cookies! So many beers, so little time. 

Staff was friendly, quick, and even packed up our leftovers to take into the park! Plus, when they knew we were getting ready to go, our last beer orders were poured into disposable cups that we took with us!

We've always liked meeting up at this place when it was ACME, and hang out on the patio, munching and drinking while waiting for the game to start. Now with Public House and a whole new menu, huge beer selection plus the other Mijita restaurant-within-a-restaurant, there are so many choices we are looking forward to the rest of the season. 

Oh, great TVs all around. No excuse to miss any game.
author: Janice A.

description:
First time visit on Tuesday before the Philly's game (Giants won, yay). 

Decent service at the bar for what was a packed house. Ordered onion rings and the fish and chips. Both were just average. While I appreciated the fresh battered onions, they weren't very substantial and were a little wimpy and more appropriate for sticking on a burger or in a sandwich, but they couldn't stand up on their own very well. The fish was a little salty and the fries looked like they were seasoned w/ something, but they didn't taste like it. Maybe the little black specks were just burned bits from the fryer?!??!?!?!

I'd probably go back since they have lots of screens for watching all kinds of other sports, but maybe I'll eat elsewhere (but not Mijita either..so overpriced!!!)
author: C G.

description:
This restaurant had the most amazing chicken wings, They were smoked and most flavorful. Today we went back for another round and were served a variety of wings that could have been bought at the Safeway Deli. Totally unimpressed and will not return for wings there.

There onion rings were, however excellent, and unusual in taste.

If they lost their chef, why not recreate a version their sensational smoked wings? 
The new ones were a bummer!
author: linda r.

description:
I'm not usually one to review a place before it has officially opened, but a few surprises that came with my order compel me to go for it for the good of yelpkind:

- The coleslaw is not mayo-based. And it has lots of celery in it.  The more of it I ate, the less I liked.  But I didn't hate it.  There's a good chance I'd order it again just to cut some of the richness of the other stuff on the menu.
- An order of pulled pork sliders includes DOS sliders.  For some unknown reason, I was expecting three.  Don't sliders usually come in trios?
- The fries that come with the fish and chips kind of sucked.  I wouldn't order them separately.  Ok, maybe just the small order.
author: Michelle K.

description:
I tried Public House Friday night and the decor and layout are improved from Acme -with a much larger bar area. However, the pricing for a beer is completely bogus. They charged $7 for Guinness draft (no so bad in inflated ballpark land), but then had the gall to add 10% sales tax and another 4% Healthy SF tax so the total cost of the beer was $8.
I religiously avoid any place that adds Healthy SF fees and the practice of adding sales tax on top of the beer price for a beer ordered at the bar is bush league and sets a bad precedent for other bars to follow. I get gouged enough for beer inside AT&T, I'm not going to volunteer to get gouged before I even get inside. I'll do my best to avoid this place in the future and pick another meeting spot before games.
author: bud e.

description: at&t west wing attached...grand pub and towering wall of kegs...multiple screens all around...ole, ole, ole, ole...two-thousand-ten fifa world cup...korea two:zero win over greece!..be the reds!..argentina one:zero win over nigeria...eleven:thirty am england versus united states of america...public house packed...scouts sent in early to reserve a large table...extensive beer menu...mostly north of $seven for mini-goblets of beers...quite expensive...bar orders only...guinness seemingly the most reasonable...being served in standard sixteen-ounce glass...bartender rejecting serving guinness on busy day...bartender substituting with a mini-goblet of dark potent stout...too crowded and too late to go back, and think over selection...drinking mini-goblet of beer...munching mijitas food from next door....england up by one...united states scoring a weak goal to tie the game...resulting in a tie final....
author: Hen A.

description: i had no idea you could bring "stuff" in to the park from public house until last week.  there's actually an entrance going into the ramps from public house complete with a ticket scanning agent as you exit public house.  if i only i knew this before...muahahaha
author: Ray R.

description: Had a great Sunday here! The manager helped switch a TV to my game. The beer list blew my mind. I love tasting small batch brews from Idaho to San Diego. The Mijita nachos are amazing and you can order them in Public House. The burger is solid and my girl enjoyed the Greek salad. Definitely coming back for another Sunday Funday!
author: Peter L.

description: Better experience on August 5th after the game. Had some specialty drafts at the bar. Bartender was great and attentive.
author: Patrick M.

description: Best place to meet up before a Giants game! The food is good (try the Pastrami!) and they have a back entrance into the ballpark so no waiting in a long line to get to your seats.
author: BARI P.

description: Was just here on Saturday with a group of 20 for a birthday and was pleasantly surprised! Granted it wasn't busy as the Giants were in town, but I would definitely come here again. The service was outstanding (a big plus for me), the cocktails strong and the food pretty good for a sports bar. Loved having SO many TV's to watch sports and they gladly put on the Sharks game for us on the nearest big screen. 2 thumbs up!
author: Habsfan B.

description: i am so psyched that this place exists.  usually when you got to a giants game, you get crappy bud lights for 9$ a pop.  it is so cool that instead you can go to Public House and get some really good beers for about the same price.  the selection is great, and they let you bring everything into the game.  you can even get your hand stamped so you can go back in during the game and get more beers.  i would have given it 5 stars, but the service was really slow (despite not being busy) and not super friendly.
author: vlad k.

description: Five stars for the water and the attentive busboys. (It really was good water). Otherwise, everything else was awful-appetizers which, though ordered first, came after the entrees; a chicken sandwich (very dry) with iceberg lettuce, not the advertised arugula, brats 1/2 the size of the buns, cold French fries, bad service...at one point our waiter asked us if we still wanted our food...I wish we had said "no" and had left.  A huge disappointment and a total waste of money. I love the Giants in spite of their neighbors . I only wonder how they could have screwed up the beer...
author: David B.

description: Good food, great beer menu, nice atmosphere. This place is definitely giving Pete's a run for it's money!
author: Mia T.

description: Live nearby and have been here several times. Food (when it's prepared correctly) is pretty good but I have now had three service issues. Either food not being cooked correctly or taking forever to arrive. To the credit of the managers they have all been very nice and accommodating but PH just needs to get the service and process fixed before I can up the rating.
author: Greg M.

description:
great beer list, although not always the freshest kegs (i'm looking at you racer x - you were much tastier at city beer)

kinda pricey, but it goes with the territory. i haven't eaten a lot of food there yet, but i've been happy so far (again, pricey).

outdoor seating with beer is a great perk!

it's an absolute cluster when there's a game, but that's also expected.
author: Wangston P.

description: Mediocre food (I know great food may not be its goal). Nice beer selection. If it were only a bar I might give it one more star.
author: Max D.

description: I really wasn't impressed on this restaurant. The food was okay and was a little over price.  We're kind of disappointed!
author: keith C.

description: Went there on Sun. after the game. It was still busy because of the Celtics game but the food was pitiful. We got the special - fried chicken - and it was served at room temperature. It probably was cooked hours earlier and served from indoor heat lamps. Traci des Jardins should be ashamed of the food coming out of this place. Sad....just really sad.
author: traci n.
